title: Technical Training Developer
description:
Transport is at the core of modern society. Imagine using your expertise to shape sustainable transport and infrastructure solutions for the future. If you seek to make a difference on a global scale, working with next-gen technologies and the sharpest collaborative teams, then we could be a perfect match.


Is your passion making people understand how our trucks work? Do you want to develop our dealer network? Then you can be the one we are looking for!

 **What do we do?**  

Technical Training contribute to the work with developing and supporting the Service Market and Retail business at Volvo Trucks. At Volvo Trucks Technical Training we develop and deliver training solutions for our dealer network, having the workshop technicians as our main target group. Our technical training offer includes both face-to-face training courses as well as online learning solutions.

  

We cooperate with a global network of technical trainers to reach the technicians in a classroom environment, through the train-the-trainer concept. The global trainer network is also involved in our training development projects. Together we all get an opportunity to work with the very latest technology and products within the truck industry.

  

Many technicians in the dealer network work with both Volvo Trucks and Renault Trucks. Therefore, we cooperate closely with the Technical Training team at Renault Trucks in Lyon.

 **Other partners are:**

* Sales Areas and Market Companies
* The Volvo Trucks Product Management and other head office functions
* Group Trucks Technology

  

We are now looking for a Technical Training Developer to extend the Technical Training team.

 **What will you do?**


As a Technical Training Developer you will develop instructor led training courses as well as online training solutions. Both established and new methods and tools will be used.

  

You will act as a trainer when handing over the training solutions to our market companies. This mainly takes place in the Training Centre in Gothenburg but you may also deliver training in other Volvo locations around the world.

  

All your work will be done in close cooperation with your colleagues at Technical Training, with other technical experts within the company and with our global trainer network.

  

Together with the rest of the team you will be a key player when continuously improving our way of working with technical training.

**Qualifications**

* University degree in relevant field, or equivalent experience
* Genuine interest in and a good understanding of trucks, truck systems and components.
* Experience from and interest in communication and knowledge transfer.
* Experience from structuring and simplifying technical information from various sources.
* Excellent presentation skills in English
* Excellent technical writing skills in English
* Skilled in using Office 365 applications
* Team player with a positive and solution-oriented attitude

  

It’s a plus if you have:

* Workshop experience
* Truck driver license

  

The position is based in Gothenburg. Occasional travelling will be required.

  

At Volvo Trucks we are actively working to establish groupings that will take maximum advantage of the strength inherent in differences in knowledge, experience, age, gender and nationality, etc. We find that well balanced working teams increases group dynamics, creativity and new approaches to solutions.

  

Last application date: October 2, 2025.

 **For further information, please contact:**  

Marcus Olsson, Director Technical Training  

Marcus.p.olsson@volvo.com

  

We value your data privacy and therefore do not accept applications via mail.

 **Who we are and what we believe in**  

We are committed to shaping the future landscape of efficient, safe, and sustainable transport solutions. Fulfilling our mission creates countless career opportunities for talents across the group’s leading brands and entities.

  

Applying to this job offers you the opportunity to join **Volvo Group**. Every day, you will be working with some of the sharpest and most creative brains in our field to be able to leave our society in better shape for the next generation. We are passionate about what we do, and we thrive on teamwork. We are almost 100,000 people united around the world by a culture of care, inclusiveness, and empowerment.

  

At **Volvo Trucks** you will be part of leading the way towards a sustainable transport industry. For nearly a century we have been innovating for people – to make life easier, better and safer. Driving progress is our promise to customers, to the industry and to society. At Volvo Trucks we share a curiosity to learn, we work with passion and we embrace change to stay ahead. Join us, together we move the world we want to live in.
company_description: Every day, we work with some of the sharpest and most creative brains in our field to leave our society in better shape for the next generation.

title: Production Engineering Developer
description:
*Are you experienced in production development and curious about what’s next? Do you want to lead your own projects and help future-proof our ways of working in a global environment? Then you might be our new Production Developer!*


At Westermo, we’re a global company with our heart still rooted in Västermo, Stora Sundby—a small village outside Eskilstuna where our main factory remains, 50 years after it all began. While we’ve grown and expanded internationally, our values and commitment to quality remain the same.


We’re now looking for a skilled and forward-thinking **Production Developer** to join our Operational Project and Development team within the Production Engineering Department. In this team, we don’t just support the organization—we inspire and guide it. We lead change, drive innovation, and shape the future of our operations through strategic development projects, continuous improvements, and close collaboration.

### **Are you our next Production Developer?**


Your role is to develop and optimize production processes—both in our main factory and across our global operations. But it’s much more than that. You’ll be a key player in shaping our operational future. You’ll work with today’s challenges while keeping a clear eye on tomorrow. You’ll analyze current processes and identify opportunities for safer, smarter, and more sustainable ways of working. You’ll develop and implement new methods, tools, and technologies that enhance safety, quality and efficiency.


Much of your work will be project-based, giving you the opportunity to lead initiatives that make a real impact. You’ll manage production development projects and contribute to product development efforts, collaborating across departments and borders.


You’ll be part of a skilled and forward-thinking team in Sweden, working closely with production developers and engineers. You’ll also engage with global colleagues, including our newly established final assembly plant in India—bringing a truly international dimension to your role. This position includes several leadership aspects by design, and we see a great opportunity for you to grow into a formal leadership role as a team leader. However, that’s not the primary focus of the role from the start.

### **Examples of your responsibilities:**

* Analyze and suggest improvements to the production flow in the factory
* Evaluate and propose investments in machines and tools
* Train and support internal staff
* Lead and participate in digitalization projects
* Lead industrialization of new products
* Documentation and standardization

### **Who are we looking for?**


We’re looking for someone who wants to make a difference. You’re driven by improvement, energized by challenges, and motivated by working and succeeding together. You’re curious, collaborative, and eager to share your knowledge while learning from others.

### **Requirements:**

* Academic background in a production-related field
* Knowledge and experience in Lean, and adjacent tools and methods
* Hands-on experience from production environments
* Strong project management skills
* Comfortable working daily in ERP systems (IFS is a plus, but not a must)
* Fluent in Swedish and English

### **Meritorious:**

* Experience in electronics production

**In return, we offer:** You will be working at the forefront of technology in a friendly, open culture where we you get the opportunity to learn from skilled colleagues every day. A mature and caring leadership in a flat organization. Through our collective bargain agreement you will be covered in terms of insurance, pension and other benefits. We like to have fun together and we regularly enjoy sports and other social activities as a team. We believe that magic happens when people meet. We are a learning organization and we truly love to try new things, think outside the box and be innovative together!

 **Basic information:**


* Location: Stora Sundby
* Job type: Full time
* Employment contract: Permanent

**Don’t miss out on this opportunity – apply today.** **For further information please contact:**


Recruiting Manager Tobias Thelberg: tobias.thelberg@westermo.com or Elin Sandell, Recruiter at elin.sandell@westermo.com

 ***About Westermo:***

*Welcome to a rapidly growing international company, thriving at the forefront of cutting edge technology. Westermo develops and manufactures advanced devices for industrial data communication, used in mission**-**critical installations and harsh industrial environments. The very robust and secure communication networks built with our products provide a high value for our customers.*

*We are focused on leveraging growth opportunities in our market* *and are devoted to delivering the world's best industrial networks. This is achieved through a very dynamic work environment where teamwork and loyalty are valued.* *Strong and honest relationships with colleagues, customers, and suppliers are important to us. We have an open culture where we share knowledge, learn from one another and explore new ideas, allowing us to constantly improve.*

*Westermo is a leading provider of Industrial Data Communications equipment to the global market. Sales are conducted through our own offices in key markets in Europe, North America, Australia and Asia, as well as through distributors and OEM customers worldwide. Development and manufacturing take place in Sweden, Ireland, Germany**and Switzerland. Westermo was founded in 1975 and today has over 480 employees with a turnover of around 1 Billion SEK. The company is a wholly owned subsidiary of Ependion, listed on the Nasdaq OMX Nordic stock exchange.*

title: Senior SW Developer
description:
Job Description:
**C++ Senior Server Developer– Lund, Sweden**


Do you have experience with Access Control or Video Management systems and a passion for innovation? Join Schneider Electric as our next C++ development and backend systems specialist to enhance the security and performance of our EcoStruxure Platform by integrating advanced security features.

 **What you’ll do**

* Design, build, and maintain efficient, secure, reusable, and reliable C++ code.
* Participate in requirements analysis and technical planning.
* Ensure high performance, quality, and responsiveness of server applications.
* Identify bottlenecks and bugs, and devise solutions to mitigate and resolve them.
* Maintain code quality, organization, and automation pipelines.

**Qualifications:**

* Bachelor’s degree or higher in Software Engineering; excellent English communication skills.
* 5+ years in C++ development with strong object-oriented design and modular, testable code practices.
* Proficient in debugging, profiling, performance optimization, and understanding of algorithms and time complexity.
* Familiar with TDD, CI/CD, agile methodologies, and architectural design patterns.
* Experience with Linux, SQL/databases, container technologies (Docker/Kubernetes) are an advantage.
* Familiarity with access control or video management systems, networking (TCP/IP), and cybersecurity principles are also a plus.
* Familiarity with physical access control or video surveillance systems, networking (TCP/IP), and cybersecurity principles are also a plus.

**Why Schneider Electric?**

* Join one of the **world’s most sustainable companies**.
* Work in a **diverse and inclusive environment** that values innovation.
* Access to **continuous learning and career development**.
* Competitive salary and **benefits tailored to the Nordics**.
* Be part of a team that’s shaping the **future of secure, smart infrastructure**.

**So, what’s next?**


Are you already imagining yourself joining our team? Good, because we can’t wait to hear from you. Apply through the link on the page.

**Where can I find out more?**

* The World’s 50 Most Sustainable Companies in 2022
* About schneider electric: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VbldHPFltQQ


 #LI-KH1
 #LI-DL1
About Our Company: **Looking to make an IMPACT with your career?**


When you are thinking about joining a new team, culture matters. At Schneider Electric, our values and behaviors are the foundation for creating a great culture to support business success. We believe that our IMPACT values – Inclusion, Mastery, Purpose, Action, Curiosity, Teamwork – starts with us.


IMPACT is also your invitation to join Schneider Electric where you can contribute to turning sustainability ambition into actions, no matter what role you play. It is a call to connect your career with the ambition of achieving a more resilient, efficient, and sustainable world.


We are looking for IMPACT Makers; exceptional people who turn sustainability ambitions into actions at the intersection of automation, electrification, and digitization. We celebrate IMPACT Makers and believe everyone has the potential to be one.


Become an IMPACT Maker with Schneider Electric – apply today!


€36 billion global revenue  

+13% organic growth  

150 000+ employees in 100+ countries  

#1 on the Global 100 World’s most sustainable corporations

  

You must submit an online application to be considered for any position with us. This position will be posted until filled. *Schneider Electric aspires to be the most inclusive and caring company in the world, by providing equitable opportunities to everyone, everywhere, and ensuring all employees feel uniquely valued and safe to contribute their best. We mirror the diversity of the communities in which we operate, and ‘inclusion’ is one of our core values. We believe our differences make us stronger as a company and as individuals and we are committed to championing inclusivity in everything we do.*  

*At Schneider Electric, we uphold the highest standards of ethics and compliance, and we believe that trust is a foundational value. Our Trust Charter is our Code of Conduct and demonstrates our commitment to ethics, safety, sustainability, quality and cybersecurity, underpinning every aspect of our business and our willingness to behave and respond respectfully and in good faith to all our stakeholders. You can find out more about our Trust Charter* *here*  

  

*Schneider Electric is an Equal Opportunity Employer. It is our policy to provide equal employment and advancement opportunities in the areas of recruiting, hiring, training, transferring, and promoting all qualified individuals regardless of race, religion, color, gender, disability, national origin, ancestry, age, military status, sexual orientation, marital status, or any other legally protected characteristic or conduct.*
company_description: Schneider Electric drives the future of energy and automation. Named the world’s most sustainable company by TIME and Statista, we create inclusive workplaces and innovative solutions.

title: Senior Software Engineer - .Net Developer
description:
Transport is at the core of modern society. Imagine using your expertise to shape sustainable transport and infrastructure solutions for the future? If you seek to make a difference on a global scale, working with next-gen technologies and the sharpest collaborative teams, then we could be a perfect match.

**About Us**
------------


At Volvo Group Digital & IT, we have a clear ambition to enable value creation at scale for the Volvo Group. With a new product centric operating model and digital technologies, we will produce digital offerings that are profitable, scalable, and differentiated. With Volvo Group Digital & IT, you will be part of a global and diverse team of highly skilled professionals, who learn continuously and embrace change to stay ahead. We have a very important role to play in reaching the Volvo Group ambitions for 2030. Do you want to be part of our transformation journey towards becoming the digital capability of the Group? The time is now.

**This will be us - your colleagues within Digital Delivery**
-------------------------------------------------------------


Digital Delivery is a new function within Volvo Group Digital & IT. It has the ambition to identify and execute on new digital initiatives in tight collaboration with TD/BAs and Group Functions as well as modernize and transform our existing solutions into products and to secure agile ways of working across the whole Digital Delivery function.  

Together with our digital talents, we will work on solution design and deliveries to improve business performance and create value at scale for Volvo Group. Included in our mission is to drive an efficient Volvo Group Digital & IT interface and Portfolio Management for the TD/BAs and Group Functions.  

  

We collaborate with other parts of the organization, both in Volvo Group Digital & IT, with TD/BAs and Group Functions. We foster an environment where ideas, thoughts and opinions can be shared. We are team players with clear common ambitions, and we win together.

**Who are you?**
----------------


You are passionate about engineering best practices, advocating for clean code, and automating routine tasks. Comfortable working in agile environments, embracing change and continuous improvement. Your transparent, committed, and reliable nature builds trust among colleagues and customers. You have a strong desire to learn and adapt to new technologies, thriving in a changing world. Possessing excellent design and problem-solving skills is second nature to you. Proficiency in English is a requirement, and you're used to or enthusiastic about working in an international environment. You have the ability to work in a changing environment and demonstrate a strong team spirit while being interested in understanding business processes.


Do you dream big? We do too, and we are excited to grow together. In this role, you will bring:

 **Your experiences**

* Proficient in the .NET platform, with a focus on backend systems and microservices
* Strong Understanding on how to work with S.O.L.I.D principles, Design Patterns. Writing Clean Code and refactoring.
* Skilled in designing and implementing GraphQL and RESTful services.
* Hands-on experience with Azure Cloud, Docker, Kubernetes, Azure Red Hat OpenShift (ARO)
* Knowledgeable and experienced in working with relational databases, particularly MS SQL Server.
* Experienced with Azure DevOps and GIT for version control and CI/CD workflows.

 **Nice to have**

* Knowledge on Event streaming platform like Azure Event Hub, Kafka
* Knowledge on security and vulnerabilities
* Well-versed in unit testing, integration testing, and Test-Driven Development (TDD).
* Knowledge with front-end development languages like Angular, React or another modern JavaScript framework
* Proficient in speaking and writing Swedish and English.

 **Your Mission If You Accept It**

* Write clean, testable, scalable code using .NET programming languages
* Always be up to date with technological developments and be proactive about the developments to be implemented to avoid any risk of technical debt.
* Review and refactor code
* Implementing business logic and developing APIs and services
**What’s in it for you?**
-------------------------


We offer a solid package of compensation and benefits, plus you will enjoy:

* Emphasis on work-life balance for personal and professional development
* Immersive experience in an agile and international DevSecOps environment
* Abundant growth and career opportunities
* Potential to work globally or cross-functionally
* Regular interactions within the team
* Close collaboration with Volvo trucks Marketing and Product sales
* Attractive work environment fostering collaboration on business-critical solutions
* Friendly atmosphere with highly skilled colleagues
* Strong and experienced team driven by teamwork and mutual improvement
**Ready for the next move?**
----------------------------


If you are curious to explore how we put our words into actions, follow us on LinkedIn and volvogroup.com.

**Have questions? Call us!**  

Contacts:  

Hiring Manager - Mukul Keshari, mukul.keshari@volvo.com

***Please note: Don’t wait until the last date to submit your application, as interviews are conducted on an ongoing basis.***

  

We value your data privacy and therefore do not accept applications via mail.

 **Who we are and what we believe in**  

Our focus on Inclusion, Diversity, and Equity allows each of us the opportunity to bring our full authentic self to work and thrive by providing a safe and supportive environment, free of harassment and discrimination. We are committed to removing the barriers to entry, which is why we ask that even if you feel you may not meet every qualification on the job description, please apply and let us decide.

  

Applying to this job offers you the opportunity to join **Volvo Group**. Every day, across the globe, our trucks, buses, engines, construction equipment, financial services, and solutions make modern life possible. We are almost 100,000 people empowered to shape the future landscape of efficient, safe and sustainable transport solutions. Fulfilling our mission creates countless career opportunities for talents with sharp minds and passion across the group’s leading brands and entities.

 **Group Digital & IT** is the hub for digital development within Volvo Group. Imagine yourself working with cutting-edge technologies in a global team, represented in more than 30 countries. We are dedicated to leading the way of tomorrow’s transport solutions, guided by a strong customer mindset and high level of curiosity, both as individuals and as a team. Here, you will thrive in your career in an environment where your voice is heard and your ideas matter.
company_description: Every day, we work with some of the sharpest and most creative brains in our field to leave our society in better shape for the next generation.

title: Power BI Developer
company_industry: IT Services and IT Consulting, IT System Data Services, and IT System Custom Software Development
description:
Importance is mainly the knowledge of Power BI as a service, and concepts that go beyond pure development of DAX, mainly:
 


* Data modelling principles
* **Power Query**
* Parameters
* Optimizing queries
* Working with and setting up dataflows
* **Governance in PBI service**
* Deployment Pipelines
* Incremental refreshes
* **Advanced analytics functionality**
* Q&A
* Decomposition Trees
* **Visual design and UX**



  





**PowerBI Lead ideal profile
 
*(core competence needed highlighted in green)***




  





 This person will oversee the Real Estate Analytics Power BI app and other analytical assets, taking ownership of best practices for process setup, access management, report development, and governance. They will guide analytical efforts and collaborate with team members to ensure data-driven insights support key business initiatives.
 


* **Responsibilities** 
 :
* **Holistic Power BI Expertise** 
 : Act as a subject matter expert in Power BI report development, defining best practices for data ingestion, semantic model design, documentation, and DAX optimization.
* **Process Development:** 
 Establish and maintain processes for governance, maintenance, and access management of analytical artifacts, including the RE Analytics App.
* **Business Requirement Implementation:** 
 Serve as a 'Feature Responsible' for new initiatives within the RE Analytics workstream, translating business requirements into actionable features.
* **Advanced Analytics Advisory:** 
 Provide feasibility on applied advanced analytics, assessing methodological approaches and best fit for relevant business problems.
* **Team Coordination:** 
 Lead and support the efforts of Power BI developers and other analytics resources, enhancing collaboration, optimizing ways of working, and fostering skill development.
* **Strategic Support:** 
 Assist the Global Analytics Manager with task definitions for varied scenarios, such as report development, exploratory analytics, causal inference modeling, etc.



  





**Key Skills** 
 :
 



**Technical Expertise in Power BI:** 
 Strong knowledge of Power BI, including experience with advanced DAX/M, data modeling, and report optimization.
 



**Communication and Design Skills:** 
 Strong ability to communicate output of analytical applications, including an understanding for appealing design principles and UX best practices to create user-friendly analytical artefacts.
 



**Analytical and Problem-Solving Skills:** 
 Strong ability to analyze data, interpret results, and apply critical thinking to assess challenges and propose solutions.
 



**Advanced Analytics Knowledge** 
 : Familiarity with, and experience from implementing various statistical methods to guide applied analytics and infer relevant take-aways.
 



**Project and Process Management:** 
 Ability to structure and drive governance, access management, and establish standardized practices relating to analytical artefacts.
 



**Leadership and Collaboration:** 
 Ability to coordinate team efforts, provide guidance, and drive continuous improvement across Analytics projects.

title: Senior .NET Developer
description:

 We are a consulting company with a bunch of technology-interested and happy people!
   

  

 We love technology, we love design and we love quality. Our diversity makes us unique and creates an inclusive and welcoming workplace where each individual is highly valued.
   

  

 With us, each individual is her/himself and respects others for who they are and we believe that when a fantastic mix of people gather and share their knowledge, experiences and ideas, we can help our customers on a completely different level.
   

  

 We are looking for you who want to grow with us!
   

  

**Job Description**
 You will join a new greenfield initiative, working on building
 **Intraday Balance & Margin Trading** 
 to MVP. The team is responsible for
 **business-critical components** 
 at the core of trading and investment platforms. As a
 **Senior .NET Developer** 
 , you will primarily focus on

 , contributing to

 and

 that drive

 .

 Qualifications

title: Cloud & AI Solution Engineer – AI Applications
description:
Are you insatiably curious, deeply passionate about the realm of AI & applications, and ready to tackle complex challenges in a dynamic environment? If so, we invite you to join our team as a
 **Cloud & AI Solution Engineer in AI Applications** 
 for commercial customers at Microsoft. Here, you'll be at the forefront of cutting-edge projects that leverage the latest technologies to drive meaningful impact. Join us and be part of a team that thrives on collaboration, creativity, and continuous learning.
   

  

 Microsoft is transforming the developer experience for AI applications across the development lifecycle. With AI Foundry and seamless integration with Azure AI, we’re leading the way in Agentic AI development where AI agents streamline development and operations. As an AI Apps Solution Engineer, you’ll help customers boost productivity and become AI-native.
   

  

 As an AI Applications Solution Engineer (SE), you will play a pivotal role in
 **helping enterprise AI developers unlock the full potential of Microsoft’s AI-powered stack across every stage of the development lifecycle.** 
 You’ll collaborate closely with engineering leaders and platform teams to accelerate AI Foundry, Azure AI, and Responsible AI, through hands-on engagements like Proof of Concepts, hackathons, and architecture workshops. This opportunity will allow you to accelerate your career growth, develop deep business acumen, hone your technical skills, and become adept at solution design and deployment. You’ll guide customers through secure, scalable solution design, influence technical decisions, and accelerate AI applications development into their deployment workflows. In summary, you’ll help customers modernize their applications and realize the full value of Microsoft’s AI platform, all while enjoying flexible work opportunities.
   

  

 As a trusted technical advisor, you’ll guide customers through secure, scalable solution design, influence technical decisions, and accelerate AI applications and agents into their development workflows. In summary, you’ll help customers modernize their applications leveraging AI and realize the full value of Microsoft’s platform.
   

  

 Microsoft’s mission is to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. As employees we come together with a growth mindset, empower others, and collaborate to realize our shared goals. Each day we build on our values of respect, integrity, and accountability to create a culture of inclusion where everyone can thrive at work and beyond.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Drive technical sales with decision makers using demos and PoCs to influence solution design and enable production deployments.
* Lead hands-on engagements—hackathons, code-with sessions, and architecture workshops—to accelerate adoption of Microsoft’s developer tools and cloud platforms.
* Build trusted relationships with developers and platform leads, co-designing secure, scalable architectures and solutions
* Resolve technical blockers and objections, collaborating with engineering to share insights and improve products.
* Maintain deep expertise in AI Foundry & App architecture (Agentic AI framework, Semantic Kernel, Foundry SDK, Responsible AI) and App architecture/cloud native dev (APIs, containerization, microservices, event-driven, Python, Java or .NET).
* Maintain and grow expertise in AI Management & Security (Gen AI Ops, Sentinel, orchestrator, monitoring).
* Represent Microsoft through thought leadership in developer communities and customer forums


**Qualifications**
 Required Qualifications (RQs)
   

  

* Proven years technical pre-sales or technical consulting experience OR Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field AND A few years technical pre-sales or technical consulting experience  OR Master's Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field AND A couple year(s) technical pre-sales or technical consulting experience  OR equivalent experience
* Expert on full stack App architecture design / modernization and cloud native dev (e.g., APIs, containerization, microservices, event-driven, Python, Java, .NET)
* Expert for AI & ML models (e.g., Agentic AI framework, AI Foundry, Semantic Kernel, Foundry SDK, Responsible AI, fine-tuning/inferencing, etc.)
* Proven ability to lead technical engagements (e.g., hackathons, PoCs, MVPs) that drive production-scale outcomes.


**Preferred Qualifications (PQs)**
* Several years technical pre-sales, technical consulting, or technology delivery, or related experience OR equivalent experience
* Proven years experience with cloud and hybrid, or on premises infrastructure, architecture designs, migrations, industry standards, and/or technology management
* Proficient on Agentic framework, AI Management & Security (e.g., Gen AI Ops, Sentinel, Responsible AI, orchestrator, monitoring)
* Skilled with 1 or more frameworks, tools, languages (e.g., GitHub, Copilot Studio, VS Code, Jupyter, PyCharm, Node.js, Python, Java, C#, C++, AI Assisted Dev Tools)
* Proficiency in Swedish is preferred.


 Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. Consistent with applicable law, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, citizenship, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application process, read more about requesting accommodations.

title: Low Code Developer
company: Novacura - Solutions and Services for ERP Systems
description:
**Kickstart Your Career as a Low-Code Developer!**
 Are you a recent graduate in software development, computer science or related field and ready to dive into the tech world?
   

  

 Novacura is looking for a Low-Code Developer to help businesses work smarter and faster by developing innovative solutions using Novacura Flow - our powerful low-code platform.
   

  

**About The Job**
 With Novacura Flow, we help customers streamline and optimize their workflows by seamlessly connecting people, systems, and data. The platform enables organizations to build custom applications with minimal coding, enhancing efficiency, flexibility, and digital transformation. With integrations to leading ERP systems like IFS and SAP, our solutions empower companies to optimize their operations.
   

  

 As a Low-Code Developer, you’ll play a key role in:
   

  

* Automating and improving business processes using Novacura Flow
* Customizing ERP solutions to meet specific customer needs


 In this role, you and your colleagues will be able to work and collaborate with large companies, both nationally and internationally in their core processes.
   

  

 We believe in shaping roles around people, not the other way around. As you grow, you’ll have the opportunity to tailor your path based on your interests, whether that’s software development, project management or process consulting. Your curiosity and drive will help define your journey.
   

  

 You will be working in-house at Novacura, collaborating closely with both colleagues and customers to deliver tailored solutions that drive real business value. We are building our presence in Stockholm, offering a dynamic and close-knit team environment. Recently, we moved into a brand-new, centrally located office on Birger Jarlsgatan - a great place to grow your career and make an impact.
   

  

**What are we looking for?**
 We are looking for a service-minded and customer-oriented individual with a flexible mindset. You thrive in a team environment, communicate effectively, and are always eager to learn and grow. In this role, you’ll often encounter challenges without immediate solutions so it’s important that you are comfortable with problem-solving, seeking support when needed, and proactively searching for information will be key to your success.
   

  

**To succeed in this role, you should have:**
* A university degree in Information Science, Technology, or a related field.
* Basic knowledge in SQL and database development.
* Basic knowledge in programming (C#, Javascript, Python or similar).
* Fluency in both Swedish and English (spoken and written).
* A proactive and solution-oriented mindset, with the ability to navigate new and complex challenges.


 It is a plus but not required if you have experience working with or knowledge of:
   

  

* IFS or other business systems (ERP).
* Low-Code platforms, such as Microsoft Power Apps/Power Platform, Mendix, Appian, OutSystems or similar.
* HTML, CSS and REST.


**What We Offer**
 We strongly believe in working with individuals who love what they do. When you get the opportunity to do what you do best, the result will be exceptional.
   

  

 We offer you a global development role in an innovative and fast-growing company at the forefront of technology, and we provide you with the opportunity to deliver real value to the customers. We offer competitive benefits, compensation based on competence/performance and highly talented Novacurians as great colleagues. Novacura offers a strong and open cooperate culture where each and every employee has the opportunity to influence the development of the company and our processes.
   

  

**How can I find out more?**
 If you think we’re a good match, apply today! Selection is done continuously so don’t miss your chance. For questions regarding the recruitment process, please contact Elin Mankert, Talent Acquisition, at elin.mankert@novacura.com. For questions regarding the position, please contact Emil Huusko, Team Lead, at emil.huusko@novacura.com.
   

  

**About Novacura**
 At Novacura we are passionate about solutions that enable our customers to work smarter and faster in their businesses. We work with several business systems and our own unique product Novacura Flow. We are a global organization with close cooperation between our offices in different countries and we have high ambitions to continue to develop and grow in all our markets.

title: Senior QA Engineer
description:
We now have a new requirement and are looking for a consultant colleague with the qualifications listed below. The position is part of our consulting business, which means you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments.
   

  

*As part of your application, you may be presented to clients/partners as part of the recruitment process. If selected for the assignment, you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments as part of our consulting business.*
**Role:**
* Develop and execute test plans and test cases based on product requirements and specifications.
* Perform manual and automated testing to identify bugs, usability issues, or performance bottlenecks.
* Report and track defects using bug tracking tools, ensuring clear documentation of issues for developers.
* Collaborate with development teams to understand features and technical implementations.
* Conduct regression, integration, and performance testing to ensure ongoing product stability.
* Ensure compliance with quality standards and best practices throughout the software development lifecycle.
* Contribute to the continuous improvement of QA processes and tools.


****Essential requirements:****
 Senior Experience in QA & Test Automation
   

  

* Proven track record as a QA Engineer with hands-on experience in automated testing, integration testing, and performance testing within complex IT environments.


 Mentoring & Leadership in Testing Practices
   

  

* Ability to mentor and guide system and acceptance testers, particularly in large-scale, multi-team programs.


 Strong Communication & Stakeholder Management Skills
   

  

* Comfortable working closely with roles such as Program Test Lead, Product Owners, Architects, and Tech Leads to ensure quality alignment.


 Experience with Large, Complex Systems/Projects
   

  

* Background in large-scale transformation initiatives, including systems with complex integrations.


 Structured & Detail-Oriented with Problem-Solving Skills
   

  

* Ability to define and organize testing efforts independently, even when initial requirements are vague or evolving.


 Technical Background in QA or Development
   

  

* Education or experience as a developer or technical tester, capable of understanding the technical landscape and test architecture.


**Meritorious:**
**Experience With Migration Testing**
 Background in supporting data or system migrations, particularly validating transitions between legacy and modern platforms.
   

  

**Mainframe/AS-400 Knowledge**
 Familiarity with mainframe systems (e.g. AS-400)
   

  

**Last day to apply** 
 : 19-09-2025
   

  

**About Us**
 We currently employ experienced consultants in areas such as System Development, AI, Machine Learning, Testing, Cloud, Infra DevOps, and IT Project Management.
   

  

 Working at Deploja is something entirely different from working at an ordinary consulting company—and we are really proud of that. So, what makes us unique?
   

  

 We simply offer more than just a high salary and greater freedom; that’s just the beginning. With us, you’ll find the work environment and opportunities you deserve. Welcome to Deploja, where the grass is indeed greener!
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Exciting assignments with our many clients. We focus on long-term projects, which gives you the opportunity to create value for the client while also developing yourself.
   

  

 🌟 A secure monthly salary – together we’ll agree on a base salary depending on your assignments.
   

  

 🚗 Company car – we encourage you to choose an electric car for a more sustainable future.
   

  

 💼 Occupational pension and great opportunities for salary conversion.
   

  

 🌴 Vacation – Would you like more than 30 days of vacation, perhaps 60 days?
   

  

 🏥 Private health insurance, accident insurance, and life insurance for increased security.
   

  

 📚 Skills development – you set your own budget and choose the training you wish to attend.
   

  

 🕑 Quality of life – Are you struggling to balance everyday life and wish to work a little less while still earning as much, if not more?
   

  

*We handle applications continuously, and due to the high workload, it's especially important to include a short motivation for the position, explaining how you meet the requirements.*

title: Ignition-utvecklare (SCADA/MES)
description:
**Bakgrund**
 Vi söker till vår kund inom tillverkningsindustrin behöver förstärka sitt IT Operations-team med en erfaren Ignition-utvecklare. Uppdraget omfattar vidareutveckling, test, driftsättning och support av SCADA- och MES-funktionalitet på Ignition-plattformen i en produktionsnära OT-miljö. Arbetet sker nära interna utvecklare och drift, med fokus på att paketera och leverera mindre uppdrag/lösningar som både fristående kapabiliteter och som delar i större leveranser. Kunden verifierar lösningsförslag inför produktion.
   

  

**Uppdragsbeskrivning / arbetsuppgifter**
* Designa och utveckla nya eller utökade funktioner i Ignition (framför allt Perspective)
* Python-skriptning och databasinteraktion (t.ex. queries, transaktioner, optimering)
* Test, felsökning, driftsättning och livscykelhantering av förändringar i produktionsmiljö
* Förbättra befintliga SCADA/MES-flöden samt kvalitetssäkra UI/UX i operatörsgränssnitt
* Dokumentera lösningar och överlämna till drift/support
* Samarbete med interna utvecklare och intressenter; självständigt driva mindre “paketerade” uppdrag från behov till leverans
* Bidra till löpande leveranser enligt överenskommen plan


**Skallkrav**
* Dokumenterad erfarenhet av utveckling på Ignition-plattformen (helst Perspective)
* Stark Python-kompetens för Ignition-skriptning
* Van att arbeta mot relationsdatabaser (design, queries, prestanda, felhantering)
* Förmåga att arbeta självständigt och ta ett uppdrag från idé till driftsatt lösning
* Mycket god svenska och engelska i tal och skrift
* Ignition Core Certification eller likvärdig erfarenhet


**Meriterande**
* Erfarenhet från OT/industriell IT i produktionsmiljö (SCADA, MES, ISA-95 e.d.)
* UI/UX-förbättringar i operatörsgränssnitt inom Ignition Perspective
* Versionshantering, CI/CD eller strukturerad releaseprocess för OT-system
* Prestandaoptimering och monitorering i Ignition-applikationer
* Erfarenhet av driftsättning/kommissionering i fabriksmiljö samt change-processer
* Erfarenhet av arbete över flera sajter och med krav på hög tillgänglighet


**Personliga egenskaper**
* Kommunikativ, samarbetsinriktad och tydlig i avstämningar
* Självgående med god förmåga att prioritera och leverera enligt plan
* Kvalitetsmedveten, noggrann och lösningsorienterad i produktionskritiska lägen


**Om Uppdraget**
* Start: ASAP
* Slut: 2025-12-31 (möjlighet till förlängning)
* Omfattning: 60% (ca 24 h/vecka)
* Plats: Primärt på plats i Göteborg eller Kungälv; möjlighet till distans upp till 2 dagar/vecka efter första månaden (första månaden ca 80% på plats). Resor till andra produktionssajter kan förekomma, exempelvis Silkeborg.
* Övrigt: Utrustning tillhandahålls av kunden. Semesterförläggning kan behöva anpassas under perioden mitten av juni–mitten av augusti.

title: Business Developer – Stockholm (Sweden)
Senior Developer - Telecom Mobile Test Probes
company_industry: Telecommunications, Software Development, and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
Hi, I'm Zandile Vanqa, your Recruiter and guide to joining CSG. At CSG, you're more than your CV. We value your unique background and believe your perspective will help us elevate the work we do together. By channelling the power of all, we transform ordinary experiences into extraordinary ones- for both our customers and our employees. Channel the power of YOU and begin the journey to becoming a CSGer.
   

  

**What You'll Do**
 Are you passionate about software development for mobile network integration? Join our team to help take our telecom testing technology to new heights.
   

  

 The CSG Stockholm team is developing an advanced telecom testing software solution called CSG Assure used by mobile operators across the globe, including leading operators like AT&T, Tata, Orange.
   

  

 CSG Assure is an artificial test traffic generation platform consisting of a cloud-based application, controllers and test probes located in around 200 countries globally.
   

  

 We are looking for a skilled developer to be part of our small, agile team to build applications that help our mobile operator customers validate and optimize mobile service performance for their roamers and local subscribers.
   

  

 You will develop our next-generation mobile test probe for 3G, 4G, 5G and IoT to simulate mobile users using voice, SMS and data services. Main development is done in C & C++ on Linux platform.
   

  

* You will develop our next-generation mobile test probe for 3G, 4G, 5G and IoT to simulate mobile users using voice, SMS and data services. Main development is done in C & C++ on Linux platform.
* You are a highly skilled, analytical, customer-focused person with a strong developer profile that enjoys taking responsibility, making sure our customers get full value of our high-tech solutions
* You will report to the Executive Director Product & Development


**You Should Have**
* Completed Degree in Computer Science or related field
* 5+ years of professional experience in software development, preferably in telecom
* Strong proficiency in C++, data structures, multi-threading and Linux system programming
* Solid understanding of AT command sets and modem communication
* Good knowledge of mobile network technologies (3G, 4G, IMS/VoLTE, 5G, IoT) and network signaling (e.g. SIP, RRC, NAS) as defined in 3GPP
* Excellent problem-solving skills and ability to work independently in a fast-paced environment.


**Bonus Skills**
* Android development experience
* Understanding of eUICC/eSIM, GSMA standards
* Experience with network monitoring tools and protocol analyzers like Wireshark, QCAT
* Familiarity with scripting languages, e.g. LUA, Shell, Perl


**Why should you apply?**
* Opportunity to work and grow your skillset in cutting-edge technologies
* Provide solutions to world-leading communication service providers
* Be part of a collaborative, innovative, international team


**Who Will Love This Job**
* A trusted team player – You foster a respectful and inclusive environment and value diverse voices.
* A growth driver – You are eager to learn and adapt quickly in a dynamic environment.
* A game changer – You embrace innovation and push boundaries in digital media.
* A communicator – You translate complex ideas into engaging and accessible content.


*Key Words: Senior Developer, Software Engineer, Mobile Networks, C++, Linux, Modem Communication, Telecom Software*
**Location(s):**
 SE.Stockholm.Office
   

  

**Accommodation:**
 If you would like to be considered for employment opportunities with CSG and need special assistance due to a disability or accommodation for a disability throughout any aspect of the application process, please call us at +1 (402) 431-7440 or email us at accommodations@csgi.com. CSG provides accommodations for persons with disabilities in employment, including during the hiring process and any interview and/or testing processes.
   

  

**Our Guiding Principles:**
**Impact:** 
 Always help and empower others, whether they’re colleagues or customers. When our employees set their minds to something, great things happen.
   

  

**Integrity:** 
 Do what’s right for our customers and our people while being authentic. We treat everyone with trust and respect—that’s just who we are.
   

  

**Inspiration:** 
 Be bold in the way you think and passionate about the work you do. Test out innovative ideas without the fear of failure.
   

  

**Our Story:**
 CSG empowers companies to build unforgettable experiences, making it easier for people and businesses to connect with, use and pay for the services they value most. For over 40 years, CSG's technologies and people have helped some of the world's most recognizable brands solve their toughest business challenges and evolve to meet the demands of today's digital economy.
   

  

 By channeling the power of all, we make ordinary customer and employee experiences extraordinary. Our people [CSGers] are fearlessly committed and connected, high on integrity and low on ego, making us the easiest company to do business with and the best place to work. We power a culture of integrity, innovation, and impact across our locations, representing the most authentic version of ourselves to build a better future together. That's just who we are. Learn more about CSG Inclusion & Impact here.

title: Motion Designer
description:
**About MAG (in brief!)** 




  





 At MAG Interactive we make word and trivia mobile games that feel good. As a part of this fun and dynamic industry, it’s our mission to spread joy to players around the world. With over 350 million downloads globally, we credit our success to our awesome colleagues and we hope you'll join the team!
 



  





**The role: Marketing Motion Designer** 




  





 We’re looking for a creative, results-driven Motion Designer to join our friendly Ad Creative team in Stockholm for a 12-month parental leave cover.
 



  





 At MAG Interactive, ideas quickly turn into measurable results. You’ll have the freedom to explore new ad concepts, see them tested within days, and learn from every outcome. Working in a supportive, inclusive team, you’ll bring your vision to life and see the real impact of your creativity in an innovative culture that values experimentation and growth.
 



  





**What you’ll be doing** 




  




* Design and deliver high-performing video ads for our mobile games.
* Keep an eye on competitor ads and industry trends for fresh inspiration.
* Test, learn, and refine quickly based on ad performance.
* Welcome feedback from the team and use it to continuously improve your work.
* Use your animation expertise alongside gameplay capture to craft engaging ads.
* Balance innovative thinking with reliable production work. Sometimes developing bold new ideas, other times adapting existing assets.
* Create ads for prototype games, even when gameplay isn’t yet available.
* Collaborate with our User Acquisition team to deliver strong, measurable results.
* Contribute to creative production across networks and ASO materials.



  





**What we’re looking for** 




  




* 5+ years of experience in marketing for games or apps.
* Proven experience creating video ads for user acquisition.
* Strong skills with Adobe Creative Suite, especially After Effects.
* Confident using Figma.
* Organized, efficient, and curious about new tools and ways of working.
* Creative and innovative, while also comfortable with day-to-day production.
* You can recognise ‘good enough’ and avoid over-polishing where it’s unnecessary.
* Experienced in using AI tools to generate ideas and streamline production.
* You are eager to be part of a supportive, high-performing team.



  





**Nice-to-haves (but not essential!)** 




  




* Illustration and layout skills for key art and feature images.
* Experience developing playable ads.



  





**Perks and Benefits** 




  




* Company mobile phone and contract
* Favorable pension
* Flexible work hours
* Seasonal kick-offs
* Monthly After works
* Company wide carbon off-setting and CSR initiatives



  





  





**At MAG, we want all of our employees to feel valued, appreciated and empowered to bring their true selves to work!** 




  





**Our recruitment processes are designed to prevent bias and discrimination against people regardless of; gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, religion, ethnicity, age, neurodiversity, disability status, or any other aspect.** 




  





  





 About MAG
 



  





 We are MAG Interactive – a leading mobile developer and publisher of casual mobile games built on a wealth of creativity and passion. We thrive on creating quality experiences that make our players want to come back for more. And Players agree! Combined, the Company’s games have been downloaded more than 350 million times. We create a good times factory with a global reach that continues to grow.
 



  





 We are all part of a creative, positive and trusting environment where everyone has a sense of ownership over their activities and pride in their work. This open and collaborative working culture at MAG is key to our ability to continuously create top notch games.
 



  





 Every game released from MAG Interactive has reached a multi-million player base and reached the #1 position in its category in a large number of countries. Our games have been selected Best of Google Play, Best Of App Store by Apple and have reached the #1 word game spot in over 100 countries.
 



  





 MAG Interactive was founded in Stockholm in 2010.

title: Software Engineer
company_industry: Financial Services, Software Development, and Banking
description:
*Vill du vara med och skapa framtidens digitala bankupplevelse – tillsammans med andra som brinner för teknik och samhällsnytta?* 




  





 Vi söker fler engagerade utvecklare som vill vara med och forma nästa generations digitala tjänster för sparande, investeringar och bank. Hos oss kombineras teknikintresse med samhällsengagemang – i team där gemenskap, samarbete och inkludering är en självklar del av vardagen. Vi tror på ett arbetsliv där det går att vara både ambitiös och mänsklig, där balans och meningsfullhet är lika viktiga som innovation.
 



  





**Om rollen** 




 Vi växer, och flera av våra utvecklingsteam söker nu nya kollegor. Som backendutvecklare hos oss arbetar du i ett agilt och självstyrande team med stort ansvar – från idé till produktion. Du får jobba med modern Java och mikrotjänstarkitektur i en miljö där vi hela tiden lär av varandra, testar nytt och strävar efter att göra skillnad för riktiga användare.
 



  





 Teknisk skicklighet är förstås viktigt – men hos oss är det lika avgörande att du tycker om att samarbeta, dela kunskap och bidra till en öppen och omtänksam teamkultur. Vi vill att du ska kunna växa både som utvecklare och människa.
 



  





**Så här jobbar vi** 




 Vi är organiserade i ca 35 autonoma utvecklingsteam, uppdelade i åtta områden, där varje team har fullt ägarskap över sin produkt, sin roadmap och sina tekniska val. Vi arbetar datadrivet och iterativt, med fokus på att skapa verkligt värde för användarna och samtidigt bevara en hållbar utvecklingstakt.
 



  





 Parprogrammering och mobbprogrammering är en naturlig del av vår vardag, liksom gemensam design och kodgranskning. Lärande sker tillsammans, genom stöd och nyfikenhet – och vi firar våra framsteg, stora som små.
 



  





**Vi tror att du** 



* Har erfarenhet av att bygga och underhålla distribuerade system i Java
* Skriver välstrukturerad, testbar och skalbar kod
* Är nyfiken, kommunikativ och trivs med att arbeta tillsammans med andra
* Har ett helhetstänk och vill bidra till både teamets och produktens utveckling
* Gillar en kultur där det är okej att fråga, dela, misslyckas och växa



  





 Har du dessutom erfarenhet av frontend (Angular), molnplattformar (som Google Cloud), datadrivet arbete eller brinner för tillgänglighet, AI eller fintech – så är det ett stort plus!
 



  





**Teknik vi jobbar med** 



* Backend: Java 21, Spring Boot, mikrotjänster, Kafka, gRPC, REST, MongoDB, Event Sourcing
* Frontend: Angular 19
* Verktyg & infrastruktur: Git, Jenkins, Grafana, Splunk, Jira, Kanban, Gigaspaces



  





**En kultur för gemenskap och hållbarhet** 




 Vi tror att de bästa resultaten uppstår i trygga team där alla får komma till tals. Därför lägger vi stor vikt vid samarbete, öppenhet och arbetsglädje. Vi strävar efter jämställda team där alla känner sig trygga att vara sig själva och bidra med sin unika kompetens. Hos oss får du utrymme att utvecklas i din egen takt och kombinera arbetet med ett hållbart liv.
 



  





 Vi värdesätter balans i livet, mångfald av perspektiv och ett hållbart arbetsliv – både för individen och samhället i stort. Och vi bryr oss – om varandra, våra kunder och vår omvärld.
 



  





 Hos oss finns techforum, mentorprogram, kompetensutveckling, nätverk för kvinnor och icke-binära inom tech – och kollegor som gärna fikar, kodar, lär och skrattar tillsammans.
 



  





**Ansökan** 




 Skicka din ansökan senast den
 **5/10** 
 . Välkommen med din ansökan!
 



  





*Erbjudanden från rekryteringsföretag/annonssäljare undanbedes.*

title: ServiceNow Developer
company_industry: Engineering Services and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
**Cleeven is an Engineering, R&D and IT consulting group** 
 enabling our clients’ R&D efforts and operational excellence. We bring expertise in innovation and technology across a wide range of sectors: energy, services & banking, aerospace & defence, transportation, pharmaceuticals & chemicals, as well as IT & Telecoms.
 



  





 We are looking for talented
 **ServiceNow Developers** 
 to join our team. As a ServiceNow Developer, you will be instrumental in the design, development, and implementation of scalable solutions on the ServiceNow platform. Your role will involve collaborating with multidisciplinary teams to deliver high-quality applications and integrations across a variety of projects.
 



  





**Your responsibilities** 




  




* Designing, developing, and customizing ServiceNow applications and modules
* Building and implementing scalable and testable solutions on the ServiceNow platform
* Collaborating with cross-functional teams on requirements gathering and system integration
* Troubleshooting, debugging, and optimizing ServiceNow applications and workflows
* Contributing to innovation and best practices in ServiceNow development



  





**Qualifications** 




  




* Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field
* Proven experience with ServiceNow development and customization
* Proficiency in
 **JavaScript, GlideScript, and ServiceNow APIs**
* Familiarity with core ServiceNow modules such as Incident, Problem, Change, Service Catalog, and CMDB
* Knowledge of relational databases (SQL) and integration methods (REST/SOAP)
* Strong analytical skills and attention to detail
* Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment



  





 Previous experience with ITIL processes, ServiceNow administration, or testing and verification of enterprise applications is considered a plus.

title: Software Engineer - AI Team | Stockholm
description:
**Tech Innovation at Apotea**
 Apotea is Sweden’s largest online pharmacy, committed to making healthcare products accessible and efficient for everyone. We’re on a mission to build the next generation of e-commerce and logistics, from scratch, but with lots of domain expertise and genuine care for our customers (We have been selected as the best e-commerce in Sweden several years in a row — and for good reason.). Our vision is to redefine how AI and automation power modern businesses — not by forcing AI into traditional workflows, but by creating AI-driven and automated systems that give humans control, insight, and the ability to apply their expertise where it matters most.
   

  

**AI + Apotea = < heart / >**
 Our Data and AI team is at the heart of innovation, building AI and ML applications that enhance customer experience, streamline operations, and create a foundation for future innovations. By following industry best practices, we develop modern data and AI architectures that deliver value to both the business and our customers.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
 As a Software Developer in the Data and AI team, you will but not limited to:
   

  

* Design, develop, and maintain high-performance, low-latency applications using .NET, Go, SQL, and Python.
* Conduct A/B testing and end-to-end testing to ensure system reliability and optimize performance.
* Implement and optimize data collection mechanisms on the website to ensure accurate and efficient data capture.
* Implement robust monitoring solutions to proactively detect and resolve issues.
* Collaborate with data engineers, ML engineers, and cross-functional teams to build AI-driven solutions that solve real-world problems.
* Contribute to the development of modern data and AI architectures, ensuring scalability and alignment with industry best practices.
* Play a key role in improving customer experience and operational efficiency through innovative technology.


**Who You Are**
 We think you are a problem-solver with a focus on delivering high-quality, impactful solutions. You are an collaborative team player who can also work independently and have a passionate about learning more about data, AI, and ML, and eager to work closely with experts in these fields and you also have:
   

  

* Proficient in .NET, SQL, and Python, with a strong understanding of software development principles.
* Experienced in A/B testing, end-to-end testing, and monitoring.
* Skilled in building low-latency, high-performance applications.
* Experienced in implementing data collection mechanisms on websites (e.g., tracking user interactions, event logging, and data pipelines).
* Skilled in data modeling, with the ability to design and maintain structured, efficient, and scalable data models.
* Familiar with software architecture principles and capable of making critical tradeoffs in design and implementation.
* Experienced or interested in working with recommendation and search systems (a plus).


**Bonus Points If You Have**
* Experience with cloud platforms like Azure or AWS.
* Knowledge of CI/CD pipelines and DevOps practices.
* Familiarity with frontend technologies.
* Experience in e-commerce, logistics, or healthcare systems.


**What Apotea Offer You**
* The chance to work on cutting-edge AI and ML projects that impact millions of customers.
* Join a flat, agile organization with minimal bureaucracy
* Drive sustainability through eco-friendly packaging and logistics
* Opportunities for career growth through training, mentorship, and industry conferences.
* Collaborate in a cross-functional, transparent environment
* Own projects from concept to deployment
* A stable, future-focused company with a meaningful mission to improve healthcare accessibility.


**About Apotea**
 Apotea.se is Sweden’s largest online pharmacy, with the country’s broadest range of over 32,000 non-prescription items and nearly 19,000 prescription drugs for humans and animals. Recognized as Sweden’s most sustainable e-commerce company (Sustainable Brand Index 2021), we simplify everyday life for our customers with fast deliveries and expert advice. In 2024, Apotea reached a turnover of SEK 6.5 billion and currently employs about 1,000 people across Stockholm, Lidingö, and Morgongåva.
   

  

 Apotea is an inclusive employer that values diversity. We welcome all applicants and strive to create a work environment where people, regardless of background, gender, age, religion, or disability, can thrive and grow.
   

  

**The process**
* Apply
* Interview 1: Culture fit
* Interview 2: Technical skills
* Background check: As a pharmacy, we always conduct a background check.
* Potential job offer


**Join Us and Make a Difference -** 
**We hope you want to be a part of our team!**
 Submit your application today—interviews are conducted on an ongoing basis, and the position may be filled immediately. Start date by agreement.
   

  

*Welcome to Apotea – where technology meets health and creates magic!*
 Apotea är Sveriges största nätapotek med fokus på hållbarhet och snabba leveranser. Vår logistik är hjärtat i verksamheten, och vi har som mål att bli Nordens största apotek och Sveriges mest hållbara företag. Tillsammans med våra kunder har vi samlat in över 100 miljoner kronor till välgörenhet, och vi fortsätter att växa varje år – med våra medarbetare som den drivande kraften bakom framgången.

title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
Vi har nu ett nytt behov och söker därför en konsultkollega med nedan kvalifikationer. Tjänsten är en del av vår konsultverksamhet vilket innebär att du blir anställd av oss och arbetar hos kund alt. interna projekt och åtaganden.
   

  

****Din profil (Skall krav)****
* Praktisk problemlösare med strategiskt perspektiv.
* Är bekväm med att tackla en legacy monolit och se möjligheter i en komplex miljö.
* Är beredd att underhålla och ansvara för ett befintligt, affärskritiskt, system
* Skriver ren och hållbar kod i .NET.
* Har god förståelse för systemarkitektur och gillar att optimera processer.
* Har erfarenhet av drift, integrationer och systemunderhåll.
* Kan samarbeta tvärfunktionellt och kommunicera med både tekniska och icke-tekniska roller.


**Meriterande**
* Erfarenhet inom e-handel
* Erfarenhet av ERP-system, lagerhantering eller logistiklösningar.
* Kunskap inom automation, scripting eller DevOps-verktyg.
* Erfarenhet av både molninfrastruktur och on-prem-miljöer.


**Sista ansökningdatum:** 
 23-09-2025
   

  

**Om Deploja**
 Vi sysselsätter idag erfarna konsulter, inom bl.a. Systemutveckling, Test, Arkitektur, IT-Projektledning, IT-Säkerhet.
   

  

 Att jobba på Deploja är något helt annat än att arbeta på ett vanligt konsultbolag – och det är vi riktigt stolta över. Vad är det då som gör oss unika?
   

  

 Vi erbjuder helt enkelt mer än bara hög lön och större frihet, det är bara början. Hos oss hittar du den arbetsmiljö och de möjligheter du förtjänar. Välkommen till Deploja, där gräset faktiskt är grönare!
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Spännande uppdrag hos våra många kunder. Vi fokuserar på långsiktiga uppdrag, vilket ger dig möjlighet att skapa värde för kunden samtidigt som du utvecklas själv.
   

  

 🌟 En trygg månadslön – tillsammans bestämmer vi en grundlön baserad på dina uppdrag.
   

  

 🚗 Tjänstebil – vi uppmuntrar dig att välja en elbil för en mer hållbar framtid.
   

  

 💼 Tjänstepension och stora möjligheter till löneväxling.
   

  

 🌴 Semester - Önskar du mer än 30 dagar semester, kanske 60 dagar?
   

  

 🏥 Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring, olycksfallsförsäkring och livförsäkring för ökad trygghet.
   

  

 📚 Kompetensutveckling – du får själv sätta din budget och välja vilka utbildningar du vill delta i.
   

  

 🕑 Livskvalitet - Har du kanske svårt att få ihop pusslet i vardagen och önskar arbeta lite mindre och ändå kunna tjäna lika mycket om inte mer?
   

  

* Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande, med hänsyn till höga arbetstrycket är det extra viktigt med en kort motivering för tjänsten som förklarar hur man möter kraven.

title: Experienced Game Designer
description:
Are you an experienced designer who want to work with a small but ambitious team where making an impact on the games we develop is not a perk, but a common goal? We are looking for a hands-on designer that can take on the responsibility of content delivery as well as heading the collaboration between cross-disciplinary strike teams.
   

  

**About Us**
 COFFEE STAIN NORTH is a small game developer based in Stockholm that belongs to the Coffee Stain Group. Since the company was founded in 2013, we have grown to 30 employees and are now open to adding a couple of new friends!
   

  

*Goat Simulator 3 is a third-person sandbox adventure developed by Coffee Stain North in which the player can live out their wildest dreams... as a goat. Released in 2022, this open-* 
 world sandbox game takes the chaotic spirit of the original to new heights and offers expanded multiplayer support, a larger and more detailed environment, and even more absurd physics-driven gameplay. Players can explore the island of San Angora solo or with friends, wreaking havoc as a goat (or one of many unlockable characters) through a wide range of quests, mini-games, and bizarre encounters.
   

  

*Understanding games like Goat Simulator 3 means appreciating the fine line between "broken" and "brilliant." If that sounds like your kind of energy,* 
 come and get to know our herd!
   

  

**The role**
 As Designer at CSN, you will work hands on in engine, build and implement features/content, be part of content ideation, fix issues, as well as support collaboration between disciplines.
   

  

**You Will**
* Carry ideas from conceptualization through to detailed design.
* Create prototypes and make final implementations for gameplay mechanics and objectives.
* Ensure that features developed by the design team are coherent with other game systems and the overall game vision.
* Help with organizing cross-disciplinary strike-teams to shape and deliver content for the game.


**Your background**
 To succeed in the role, we see that you have 4+ years of experience in a game designer role and have been part of at least one full project cycle. We work in Unreal Engine 4 and Blueprint visual scripting and prior work experience with these tools is a big plus.
   

  

 To enjoy this role, we believe that you are a person who can be part of fostering a collaborative environment with a focus on ideas and solutions. Furthermore, we believe that your previous experience enables you to identify and implement improvements that enhance efficiency and productivity, all with the end goal of creating designs that prioritize the player's experience. If you also want to infuse your work with humor, we could be a match!
   

  

 At CSN we have employees from different parts of the world, and it’s therefore mandatory to be fluent in English, both verbally and in writing.
   

  

 Lastly, we believe we can do even better as a team when your creativity shapes not only your own work but also our studio culture and our games. We actively work to empower our employees by helping everyone strive toward more responsibility, ownership, and autonomy. You will be an important part of this, and it’s therefore important to us that you have the same mindset.
   

  

**Perks** 
**of working at Coffee Stain**
 We offer competitive salaries and excellent benefits that go beyond the usual payments to your pension fund and insurances.
   

  

* We believe that a healthy body leads to a healthy mind, so on top of the wellness grant you get some paid time off to work out. Did we mention there are several gyms right beside our office?
* Every fourth week it’s creative Friday which lets your inner passion blossom.
* To have fun together and get inspired, we play games on the clock every fourth Friday.
* We also have great parental benefits, including extra pay on top of what you get from the social insurance agency during your parental leave.
* And, of course, you will be part of a wonderful team of colleagues working on an exciting high-profile project.


**Practical info**
 The position is permanent, full-time, 40 hours per week. We have a hybrid setup and offer the possibility of working from home two days per week. Our office is newly renovated, and located in Kungsholmen, Fridhemsplan. We have, among other things, a ping-pong table, a big lounge area where we hang out, watch movies, or play games together, and last but not least – a giant goat statue (what more do you need?).
   

  

 Apart from us, the Coffee Stain Group consists of a myriad of successful studios, among them COFFEE STAIN STUDIOS (Sanctum and Satisfactory), Ghost Ship Games (Deep Rock Galactic), Tuxedo Labs (Teardown) and COFFEE STAIN PUBLISHING who work with close partners like Iron Gate (Valheim), to name a few.
   

  

**Yo** 
**ur application**
 If you are interested, please apply! Due to GDPR, we can’t accept applications through email. If you have any questions regarding the role, please reach out to Maria Sjöman, HR, maria.sjoman@coffeestain.com.
