title: Senior Nätverkstekniker
description:
Vi har nu ett nytt behov och söker därför en konsultkollega med nedan kvalifikationer. Tjänsten är en del av vår konsultverksamhet vilket innebär att du blir anställd av oss och arbetar hos kund alt. interna projekt och åtaganden.
   

  

**Din profil (Skall krav)**
* Minst 8 års aktuell och relevant arbetserfarenhet av stora och komplexa Campus/wan nätverk
* Minst 8 års arbetserfarenhet av Cisco routing och switching
* Minst 2 års aktuell och relevant arbetslivserfarenhet av Cisco Catalyst Center
* Minst 2 års erfarenhet av VXLAN/EVPN
* Erfarenhet av Infoblox DNS/DHCP


**Meriterande**
* Erfarenhet av arbete på en myndighet med minst 10 000 anställda
* Erfarenhet av att ha arbetat med ärenden och beställningar i Service Now
* Erfarenhet av praktiskt arbete med underhåll, livcykelhantering och vidmakthållande av komponenter rörande IT- infrastruktur
* Erfarenhet av migreringar och uppgraderingar av komponenter rörande IT- infrastruktur med fokus på nätverk


**Sista ansökningdatum:** 
 23-09-2025
   

  

**Om Deploja**
 Vi sysselsätter idag erfarna konsulter, inom bl.a. Systemutveckling, Test, Arkitektur, IT-Projektledning, IT-Säkerhet.
   

  

 Att jobba på Deploja är något helt annat än att arbeta på ett vanligt konsultbolag – och det är vi riktigt stolta över. Vad är det då som gör oss unika?
   

  

 Vi erbjuder helt enkelt mer än bara hög lön och större frihet, det är bara början. Hos oss hittar du den arbetsmiljö och de möjligheter du förtjänar. Välkommen till Deploja, där gräset faktiskt är grönare!
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Spännande uppdrag hos våra många kunder. Vi fokuserar på långsiktiga uppdrag, vilket ger dig möjlighet att skapa värde för kunden samtidigt som du utvecklas själv.
   

  

 🌟 En trygg månadslön – tillsammans bestämmer vi en grundlön baserad på dina uppdrag.
   

  

 🚗 Tjänstebil – vi uppmuntrar dig att välja en elbil för en mer hållbar framtid.
   

  

 💼 Tjänstepension och stora möjligheter till löneväxling.
   

  

 🌴 Semester - Önskar du mer än 30 dagar semester, kanske 60 dagar?
   

  

 🏥 Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring, olycksfallsförsäkring och livförsäkring för ökad trygghet.
   

  

 📚 Kompetensutveckling – du får själv sätta din budget och välja vilka utbildningar du vill delta i.
   

  

 🕑 Livskvalitet - Har du kanske svårt att få ihop pusslet i vardagen och önskar arbeta lite mindre och ändå kunna tjäna lika mycket om inte mer?
   

  

* Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande, med hänsyn till höga arbetstrycket är det extra viktigt med en kort motivering för tjänsten som förklarar hur man möter kraven.

title: (Associate) Microsoft Systems Technical Service Manager – based in Luxembourg
description:
***This position is based at our Luxembourg headquarters and requires regular office presence.** 
 The EIB offers you the opportunity to live and work in a truly international and multi-cultural environment. We also offer relocation support.*
 The
 **EIB** 
 , the European Union's bank, is seeking to recruit for its Group Information Systems Directorate (GIS), Platforms & Services Department (P&S), Infrastructure Services Division (IS), UC & Windows Client Services Unit (UCWS) at its headquarters in Luxembourg, an
 **(Associate) Microsoft Systems Technical Service Manager\*.**
**This is a full-time position at grade 4/5 for which the EIB offers a permanent contract.**
* internal benchmark (Associate) Engineer IT Tech & Infra


*Panel interviews are foreseen as from September 2025.*
 Purpose
   

  

 You will manage the technology roadmap, design, and delivery of projects, as well as the daily operations for Windows Operating System Servers. Your role will be key in aligning technology solutions with the organisation's needs and contributing directly to the achievement of the EIB's strategic objectives
   

  

 Operating Network
   

  

 As a Microsoft Servers Systems Technical Service Manager, you will be part of the UC & Windows Client Services Unit within Infrastructure Services Division. You will be responsible for providing senior technical expertise and leadership in support for Windows Operating Systems.
   

  

 The successful candidate will report to the Head of UC & Windows Client Services Unit
   

  

 Accountabilities
   

  

* Deliver projects and manage the Windows Servers daily operations with the support of a team of consultants and / or a managed services provider
* Create, maintain a technology roadmap for Windows Operating Systems Servers in a context of fast automation and digitalisation of EIB activities
* Maintain Windows Services, address vulnerabilities in collaboration with IT Security Unit, manage patching campaigns and upgrades to ensure compliance
* Assess impact of releases, features or changes on the IT environment and advise relevant stakeholders on a recommended approach
* Work closely with development, engineering, support, infrastructure, and business operations teams to drive problems and incident resolution
* Provide risk mitigation measures, maintain systems compliance and address audit findings
* Contribute to the execution of Windows Services disaster recovery, business continuity requirements and capacity plans
* Actively propose ideas of improvement and optimisation for the existing processes and services and then track their development and implementation
* Ensure that projects and processes are managed properly and that solutions are designed and implemented in line with internal policies, procedures and that best practice, security recommendations and industry standards are respected
* Provide advice, in consultation with various IT teams in the context of projects and act as a change owner to introduce innovative approaches within the Bank’s IT solutions


**Qualifications**
* University degree (minimum an equivalent to a Bachelor) preferably in Computer Science, Information Systems, or related disciplines
* Minimum 3 years of professional experience in Windows system administration, including troubleshooting, performance optimization, and implementing new solutions.
* Experience with tools such as MECM, Intune, SCOM, and Active Directory / Entra ID (including Group Policy management).
* Experience contributing to IT infrastructure projects or upgrades, ideally involving new technology rollouts.
* Experience with PowerShell scripting skills for automation and system administration tasks.
* Understanding of IT security practices, such as patching, secure builds, and vulnerability remediation.
* Understanding of networking fundamentals (e.g., TCP/IP, VPN); exposure to F5, Single Sign-On, or Splunk is an advantage.
* Familiarity with cloud platforms such as Azure or AWS and/or automation tools like Azure DevOps is a plus.
* Exposure to Linux environments or mixed OS ecosystems is an advantage but not mandatory.
* Excellent knowledge of English and/or French (\*\*\*), with a good command of the other. (Knowledge of other EU languages would be an advantage).


 Competencies
   

  

*Find out more about EIB core competencies* 
 here
   

  

 To find out more about our eligibility criteria click here
   

  

*(\*\*\*) Unless stated explicitly as a required qualification, a good command of French is not a pre-requisite for hire. As both English and French are however official working languages of the EIB, proficiency in both languages is a pre-requisite for your future career development. Any language clause in your contract must be fulfilled in order for you to be eligible for a promotion (either via the annual appraisal cycle or via an internal selection process). Proficiency is understood to mean the attainment of level 5 of the Inter Institutional language courses, corresponding to B1.2 of the Common European Framework of Reference for Languages (CEFRL). The Bank offers appropriate training support.*
 We hire and value talent with unique characteristics, creating a work environment where they can be themselves. We believe that Diversity, Equity and Inclusion makes us a performing and innovative organisation. We encourage all suitably qualified and eligible candidates to apply regardless of their gender identity/expression, age, racial, ethnic and cultural background, religion and beliefs, sexual orientation, disability or neurodiversity.
   

  

 We strongly invite applicants with a disability, neurodivergent profile or chronic condition to request reasonable accommodations at any stage during the recruitment process. Please contact the EIB Recruitment team Jobs@eib.org who will ensure that your request is handled.
   

  

 By applying for this position, you acknowledge the importance of maintaining the security and integrity of the Information of the EIB Group. In case of selection for the position you agree to comply with all measures (policies, controls, document classification and management) implemented by the EIB Group to prevent unauthorised disclosure of any information or any damage to the EIB Group reputation.
   

  

*This is an open campaign to consecutively fill open positions. The campaign will remain open until position is filled. Applications will be reviewed in order of receipt.*

title: Cyber Security Lead
company_industry: IT Services and IT Consulting and Information Services
description:
We are looking for a highly skilled and experienced security lead to oversee the security operations and ensuring the protection of sensitive data, IT infrastructure and critical business applications. An ideal candidate should have a strong background in cybersecurity, risk management and security architecture with the ability to lead a team and implement robust security measures.
 








**Key Responsibilities:** 



* Lead the security team in daily operations, Incident response and threat mitigations.
* Collaborate with IT and business leadership to align the security initiatives with business goals.
* Develop and implement the security policies, Procedures.
* Manage security services like Vulnerability Management, Endpoint security, Risk management, PKI and Network security.
* Conduct regular risk assessments and drive the identifies risks for remediation.
* Ensure compliance with relevant security frameworks ISO27001, NIST and GDPR.
* Mentor and train the security team members in the best practices and new technologies.
* Define Security Roadmap/Strategy and coordinate the initiatives across the organization.
* Define and drive cloud security programs to secure resources on cloud (Azure, AWS, GCP etc.)
* Develop & maintain up to date Information Security policies, processes, and guidelines.
* Review and approve information security specifications, any exceptions/deviations to security policies submitted by internal stakeholders.
* Lead Incident response efforts including detection, analysis and remediation. Coordinate with all internal and external stakeholders during any security breaches.
* Define and conduct Security awareness trainings and programs.
* Evaluate emerging cybersecurity threats and develop effective security controls.
* Oversee Audits and ensure corrective actions are implemented for NC’s and findings.
* Establish strong governance with the team by creating presentations and reports.
* Conduct senior management reviews periodically.
* Follow and promote security best practices (from NIST, CIS etc.) within the organization.
* Achieve security goals, objectives and drive continual improvement to mature the security posture of the organization.
* Contribute towards the digital transformation journey of the organization.








**Qualifications:** 



* Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Information Technology.
* Excellent Verbal and Written communication skills and Leadership skills.
* **10-12 yrs of experience in IT security with at least 3 yrs experience in leadership role.**
* Certifications: Az-900, Az-500, CISM or equivalent is preferred.
* Strong knowledge on Endpoint security (Defender for endpoint), Vulnerability Management, Risk Management, PKI and Network security.
* Should be familiar with Cloud Security (AWS, Azure).
* Candidate should have very good Problem solving & analytical skills.
* Candidate should shave good knowledge on ITIL Process.

title: Front Office Receptionist
description:
Radisson Hotel Group is one of the world's largest hotel groups with ten distinctive hotel brands, and more than 1,460 hotels in operation and under development in 95+ countries. The Group’s overarching brand promise is Every Moment Matters with a signature Yes I Can! service ethos.
   

  

  

  

 People are at the core of our business success and future. Our people are true Moment Makers and together we bring the culture, spirit, environment and opportunities that empower you to be your best, every day, everywhere, every time. Together, we make Every Moment Matter.
   

  

  

  




**Job Description**

 Are you ready to elevate the guest experience from check-in to check-out and everything in-between? Say Yes I Can! and be a part of our dynamic world of Moment Makers.
   

  





 We are currently seeking a
 **Receptionist** 
 to join our vibrant team. At Radisson Blu Waterfront Hotel, we are in search of individuals who go beyond the resume – those with character, skills, talents, and a passion for creating memorable experiences.
   

  





 As a
 **Receptionist** 
 you bring an unmatched level of dedication, a focus on delivering exceptional service, and a genuine passion for creating positive guest experiences to our dynamic Front Office Team.
   

  





 Our
 **Receptionists** 
 love the hustle and bustle of life! It’s not just about check-in and check-out. It’s about everything in-between
   

  




* You will be our guests’ superhero ensuring all aspects of the guest journey and experience are delivered to the highest level
* You will exude patience, empathy and have the personality to host the show
* As an integral part of the team, you will work proactively to ensure guest satisfaction and the smooth running of the front office department


**Qualifications**
* Flexibility and a positive, Yes I Can! Attitude
* An eye for detail
* Is a creative problem-solver
* Passionate about creating extraordinary service
* Ability to work as part of a team to ensure guest satisfaction
* Strong verbal communication skills
* Fluent in English
* Fluent in Swedish
* Likes having fun at work

**Additional Information**

**Why Join Radisson Hotel Group?** 
  

  





**Live the Magic of Hospitality -** 
 Be part of a team that creates
 **exceptional experiences and memorable moments** 
 every day. Let your
 **Yes I Can!** 
 spirit shine as you bring hospitality to life.
   

  





**Build a Great Career -** 
 No matter your background or experience, we invest in your
 **growth, learning, and career development** 
 —helping you reach your full potential.

 **inclusive, fun, and meaningful** 
 . We celebrate diversity, support one another and foster a sense of belonging through our
 **Employee Resource Groups and inclusion initiatives** 
 .
   

  





**Lead with Your Ambition -** 
 Your ideas, passion and drive matter! We empower you to
 **make a difference** 
 —in hospitality, your community and beyond.
   

  





**Enjoy Global & Local Perks -** 
 No matter where you’re located, you’ll enjoy exclusive global benefits - like special hotel rates for you and your loved ones at our hotels worldwide. Plus, you’ll have access to local perks and rewards tailored to your country, making your experience even more rewarding!
   

  





**Join us in shaping the future of hospitality!** 
 If you’re ready to
 **bring your talent, energy, and passion** 
 , we’d love to hear from you.
   

  





**Apply now and let’s make every moment matter.** 
  

  





 We welcome applicants from all
 **backgrounds, abilities, and experiences** 
 . If you need any adjustments during the application process, please let us know.

title: IT Operations Specialist
description:
***Do you want to be at the forefront of protecting our society against cyber threats? We are looking for an IT Operations Specialist to join the most dedicated team of cyber specialists in our Internal IT team.***
**About Truesec – A Leading Cybersecurity Company**
 Since 2005, Truesec has been a native cybersecurity company, driven by one single purpose: Creating safety and sustainability in a digital world by preventing cyber breaches and minimizing impact. Over the years, we’ve earned the trust of organizations worldwide and gained a strong reputation internationally. Our team consists of dedicated specialists covering the entire spectrum of cybersecurity – with capabilities in Predict, Prevent, Protect, Respond, and Recover.
   

  

 Today, we employ around 340 employees – and as cybercrime grows, we need to grow. To support that goal, we are now looking for an IT Operations Specialist who wants to make a difference in our Internal IT team.
   

  

**Our Internal IT team**
 Our Internal IT team is a vital part of Truesec’s Technology organization, dedicated to ensuring the stability, security, and continuous development of our internal infrastructure. We work closely with colleagues across the company, supporting their daily operations and enabling them to deliver world-class cybersecurity services. By combining deep technical expertise with a consultative approach, our team drives innovation, automation, and system integrations, making sure Truesec’s internal environment is robust, efficient, and always evolving to meet new challenges.
   

  

**The Role**
 As an IT Operations Specialist in our Internal IT team, you will:
   

  

* Work with operations, support, and development of our internal systems and integrations.
* Handle support cases at all levels, from standard to advanced (level 1–3).
* Drive and maintain automation, as well as develop new features and integrations between systems.
* Maintain cloud environments and collaborate with vendors, work with internal migration projects and incident management
* Be a key part of building and improving our internal IT structure, ensuring daily stable operations and continual development.


 You will collaborate with others in the tech organization and experts from various fields, especially within our Secure Infrastruture domain and sensitive deliveries. Daily challenges include balancing centralized vs. local solutions, innovation, and problem-solving.
   

  

**Your Potential Background**
 We believe you have several years of experience in IT operations, preferably with a focus on automation and integrations. You have worked in corporate environments with user management, permissions, and operational support, and have a good understanding of processes around system support and maintenance.
   

  

**Need to have:**
* Experience with Azure, Entra ID, Microsoft 365, Intune, PowerShell
* Understanding of networks and infrastructure on a general level
* Experience with DevOps and Infrastructure as Code (IaC)
* Strong communication skills in both Swedish and English
* Ability to work independently as well as closely in a team
* Flexibility and willingness to learn – a high level of security awareness is a must


**Nice to have:**
* Experience with AWS and Google Cloud
* Network and/or security experience
* Other scripting or programming languages (e.g. Python, Terraform or Javascript)


**What We Offer**
* The unique opportunity to work at one of the leading cybersecurity companies in the Nordics – daily challenges, constant development, and possibilities to move within the organization.
* A culture of internal knowledge sharing and learning from some of the world’s leading experts
* An internal IT role with a consultative approach – supporting the entire organization in finding technical solutions and enabling colleagues to excel in their roles


**Join Our Mission Toward a Safe Digital Future**
 If you truly want to make a difference and make our world a little bit safer, this is the place for you. At Truesec, you'll get to be at the forefront of fighting cybercrime instead of reading about it in the news. This is your chance to be part of an exciting journey in a leading cybersecurity company – and learn from some of the best in their field.
   

  

 Are you ready to team up with the most dedicated team of experts and be part of a meaningful mission? Then we are excited to get to know you!
   

  

 Apply today and become part of the only company in the Nordics working at this level within cybersecurity – where you will develop, grow, and make a real difference every day.

title: Security Operations Specialist
description:
**Company Description**
***Statistics show that women and underrepresented groups tend to apply to jobs only if they meet 100% of the qualifications. Sobi encourages you to change that statistic and apply. Rarely do candidates meet 100% of the qualifications. We look forward to your application!***
 At Sobi, the work we do every day redefines the standards of care and transform the lives of people living with rare diseases.
   

  

 As a diverse team of entrepreneurial people, we are passionate about our growth journey towards becoming a global leader, making a difference for rare disease patients, moving quickly and always challenging the status quo.
   

  

 We are committed to an inclusive, sustainable and flexible workplace that fosters growth and development.
   

  

**Job Description**
 Are you passionate about identity, access, and vulnerability management—and eager to make a real impact on how a modern organization secures its digital assets? We are looking for a Security Operations Specialist to drive our IAM and vulnerability management program; while also ensuring we work efficiently and strategically with our external Security Operations Center (SOC).
   

  

 In this role, you will take ownership of our identity lifecycle processes, access governance, and privileged access models. You will also coordinate vulnerability management activities, ensuring risks are identified, prioritized, and remediated in collaboration with IT and business stakeholders. While our SOC manages the majority of alerting and threat hunting, you will act as the key interface—testing, validating, and continuously improving our partnership with the SOC.
   

  

 Collaboration is at the heart of our team. You will work closely with colleagues across IT, HR, and business functions, while also being self-driven and capable of making independent decisions. If you are naturally curious about emerging cyber threats, identity governance, and vulnerability trends, we want to hear from you!
   

  

 This position is based at our Global Headquarters in Stockholm, Sweden, reporting to the Head of Cyber Security & Network.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Identity & Access Management (IAM):
+ Lead and improve identity lifecycle processes, including provisioning, deprovisioning, and access reviews.
+ Design and enforce access governance models (least privilege, conditional access, privileged identity management).
+ Collaborate with HR, IT, and application owners to maintain accurate identity data and role mappings.
+ Support integration and maintenance of IAM tools and platforms (e.g., Azure AD, Entra ID, PAM solutions).
+ Conduct periodic access audits and contribute to compliance reporting.
+ Drive automation and efficiency in onboarding/offboarding and access management workflows.


* Vulnerability Management:
+ Coordinate vulnerability scanning, assessment, and remediation activities.
+ Track and report on vulnerability status, risk levels, and remediation progress.
+ Work with IT and business teams to prioritize and address vulnerabilities based on risk.
+ Contribute to vulnerability management policy and process improvements.


* SOC Partnership & Security Operations:
+ Act as the primary liaison between internal teams and the SOC, ensuring SOC services align with business needs.
+ Validate SOC alerts and outputs, escalate and follow up on incidents, and provide feedback to improve detection logic and workflows.
+ Test and challenge the SOC’s effectiveness through exercises, tuning, and continuous improvement initiatives.
+ Coordinate with SOC and internal stakeholders during incident handling and post-incident reviews.


* Policy, Compliance & Continuous Improvement:
+ Support enforcement of access control policies and identity governance.
+ Assist in audit preparation, evidence collection, and compliance reporting.
+ Participate in security awareness initiatives, reporting, dashboarding, and support for compliance frameworks (e.g., CIS18, NIS2).
+ Monitor threat, vulnerability, and IAM trends to recommend improvements.


**Qualifications**
**About you**
 You are a proactive and analytical problem-solver with a strong passion for identity, access, and vulnerability management. You thrive in collaborative environments, communicate effectively with both technical and non-technical stakeholders, and have a keen attention to detail. In our fast-moving, entrepreneurial environment, you take initiative and stay one step ahead of potential risks.
   

  

**Key Qualifications**
* 2–5 years of experience in IAM, vulnerability management, or security operations (preferably with Microsoft XDR/SIEM platforms).
* Strong understanding of identity governance, access management, and privileged access models.
* Experience with IAM tools (e.g., Azure AD, Entra ID, PAM solutions) and vulnerability management platforms.
* Familiarity with SOC processes, incident response, and security monitoring.
* Excellent communication and collaboration skills.
* Analytical mindset with attention to detail.
* C1 (advanced) level of Swedish & English required.
* Meriting: Experience with Microsoft Entra, ServiceNow, and automation of IAM/vulnerability processes.


 Here at Sobi we live by our core values: Care, Ambition, Urgency, Ownership and Partnership!
   

  

**Additional Information**
**How to apply**
 We have an ongoing selection process in this recruitment and ask you to send your application as soon as possible. Click apply and include your resume in English.
   

  

**Why Join Us?**
 Here At Sobi, Our Mission And Culture Get Us Excited To Come To Work Every Day, But Here Are a Few More Reasons To Join Our Team
   

  

* Emphasis on work/life balance
* Collaborative and team-oriented environment
* Opportunities for professional growth
* Diversity and Inclusion
* Competitive compensation for your work
* Making a positive impact to help ultra-rare disease patients who are in need of life saving treatments


 Sobi is a global company with over 1,800 employees in more than 30 countries and are committed to the societies where we operate. We are a specialised international biopharmaceutical company transforming the lives of people with rare and debilitating diseases, providing reliable access to innovative medicines in the areas of haematology, immunology, and specialty care. Sobi’s share is listed on Nasdaq Stockholm. More about Sobi at sobi.com and LinkedIn.
   

  

 We know our employees are our most valuable asset and our culture conveys that. We offer a competitive benefits package, to support the health and happiness of our staff.
   

  

**Sobi Culture**
 At Sobi, we refuse to accept the status quo. This is because we have witnessed first-hand the challenges facing those affected by rare diseases and have used this knowledge to shape our business to find new ways of helping them.
   

  

 As a specialized biopharmaceutical company, we are dedicated to rare diseases. And we see this focus as a strength. By effectively turning our research into ground-breaking treatments, we help make medicine more accessible and open more possibilities for patients and more opportunities for those caring for them. This has been our approach since day one, but we know we can’t change the world of rare diseases on our own. Accomplishing this requires strong partnerships with patients, partners and stakeholders across the entire value chain. Together, we define how our business can create solutions that serve the needs of those affected by rare diseases while facilitating sustainable growth.

title: Full Stack Engineer
description:
**Do you want to work at one of Sweden’s & Europe’s Best Workplaces?** 




 Hey, don’t just take our word for it. We’ve proudly won the Great Place to Work award multiple times.
 



  





**How, you may ask?** 




 Because human connection, inclusion, and innovation lead everything we do.

 to help us architect, build, and launch scalable products.

 Here, we
 **celebrate our differences,** 
 so no matter your background, we encourage you to apply.
 



  





**Remote work in Sweden is available!**

title: Software Engineer - IT operations
description:
Apotea is Sweden’s leading online pharmacy, committed to making healthcare accessible and efficient for everyone. Our IT Operations team is at the core of keeping our systems stable, reliable, and continuously improving. We are now looking for a
 **Software Engineer** 
 who is passionate about building, maintaining, and evolving the systems that power Sweden’s largest online pharmacy.
   

  

 This is a role for someone who thrives on ownership, problem-solving, and action. You are both a
 **doer and a thinker** 
 – someone who ensures smooth daily operations while driving improvements, efficiency, and change. You care deeply about the customer experience and enjoy working closely with cross-functional teams to align technology with Apotea’s business goals.
   

  

**Your role as a Software Engineer – IT Operations at Apotea:**
* Develop, maintain, and optimize our IT operations systems to ensure reliability and scalability.
* Take ownership of incidents and issues, driving them to resolution with a customer-first mindset.
* Implement improvements and efficiency gains across processes, systems, and workflows.
* Collaborate with business stakeholders, product owners, and technical teams to align IT operations with organizational goals.
* Automate where possible – reduce manual work by introducing smarter solutions.
* Ensure security, compliance, and stability in line with Apotea’s responsibility as Sweden’s largest online pharmacy.
* Mentor and support colleagues, sharing knowledge and fostering a collaborative culture.


**Who You Are**
 We’re seeking a
 **practical problem solver with a strategic mindset** 
 – someone who enjoys both getting things done and planning for the bigger picture.
   

  

**You’re a SOFTWARE ENGINEER Who**
* Writes clean, maintainable code (.net) that supports long-term operations.
* Understands system architecture and enjoys optimizing processes.
* Has strong troubleshooting and debugging skills – you enjoy solving problems under pressure.
* Brings hands-on experience with operations, integrations, and system maintenance.
* Knows how to work cross-functionally and communicate with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.


**Bonus Points If You Have**
* Experience with ERP systems, warehouse management systems, or logistics tech.
* Skills in automation, scripting, or DevOps tools.
* Knowledge of cloud infrastructure and on-prem servers.
* Swedish language skills (not required, but a plus).


**What Apotea Offers You**
* The chance to work on complex IT operations that directly impact millions of customers.
* Join a flat, agile organization with minimal bureaucracy.
* Drive sustainability through eco-friendly packaging and logistics.
* Career growth opportunities through training, mentorship, and industry conferences.
* A transparent, cross-functional environment where you can make a real impact.
* A stable, future-focused company with a meaningful mission: improving healthcare accessibility.


**About Apotea**
 Apotea.se is Sweden’s largest online pharmacy, with the country’s broadest range of over 32,000 non-prescription items and over 19,000 prescription drugs for humans and animals. Recognized as Sweden’s most sustainable e-commerce company (Sustainable Brand Index 2021), we simplify everyday life for our customers with fast deliveries and expert advice. In 2024, Apotea reached a turnover of SEK 6.5 billion and currently employs about 1,000 people across Stockholm, Lidingö, and Morgongåva.
   

  

 Apotea is an inclusive employer that values diversity. We welcome all applicants and strive to create a work environment where people, regardless of background, gender, age, religion, or disability, can thrive and grow.
   

  

**Recruitment Process**
* Apply
* Interview: Screening
* Interview: Technical Capabilities
* Interview: Culture Fit
* Background Check (as a pharmacy, we always conduct this)
* Offer Presented


**Location:** 
 Sveavägen 168, Stockholm, Sweden
   

  

**Reports to:** 
 Head of IT Operations
   

  

**Application**
 Do not hesitate to send in your application today. For more information or questions, visit our career page or contact us at jobb@apotea.se. We do not accept applications via email.
   

  

 📌
 **Join us and make a difference!**
 Submit your application today – interviews are conducted on an ongoing basis, and the position may be filled immediately. Start date by agreement.
   

  

 Welcome to Apotea – where technology meets health and creates magic!
   

  

 Apotea är Sveriges största nätapotek med fokus på hållbarhet och snabba leveranser. Vår logistik är hjärtat i verksamheten, och vi har som mål att bli Nordens största apotek och Sveriges mest hållbara företag. Tillsammans med våra kunder har vi samlat in över 100 miljoner kronor till välgörenhet, och vi fortsätter att växa varje år – med våra medarbetare som den drivande kraften bakom framgången.

title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
Development at Nolimit City (part of Evolution AB) is a challenging and exciting role where you will be part of a team dedicated to creating solutions that redefine our industry. By working in small, highly collaborative teams, you and your team will have clear ownership of one of our most important new initiatives.
   

  

 At Nolimit City, we optimize for quality, fast flows, and iterative development with short feedback loops. We have a strong focus on end-to-end ownership, continuous improvement, monitoring, and experimentation. We strive to have teams that are inclusive, helpful, and have a strong sense of ownership for what they build. Our engineers make some of the most significant decisions for the company, and we are looking for open and curious developers. As part of the Nolimit City team, you will be part of one of Sweden's fastest-growing companies and contribute to creating value for our players worldwide.
   

  

 We are expanding several of our engineering teams, including the team working on new initiatives with innovative products for our end users and work on our core products.
   

  

 Although we prefer that you're working on-site we also undertand that you have a life outside of work, meaning that working remote from time to time, leaving early, coming in late etc is not something unusual for us. A bit of a cliche; but we do in fact offer a great deal of freedom but with that comes responsibility.
   

  

 What you'll do
   

  

* Own the product from start to finish. Decide how it is best built, tested, deployed, and monitored.
* Work with large-scale, highly available, and robust modern systems.
* Be an integral part of a team and its culture and ways of working.
* Work with automated deployment enabling release multiple times a day.
* Succeed, fail, and learn together with other competent and talented people. We believe in an environment that offers growth opportunities and see education as a result of failure that brings us closer to the next breakthrough.
* Take responsibility for system design, work together with domain architects, own end-to-end problems, manage stakeholder communication, and mentor junior engineers.


 Who you are
   

  

* Tech stack should include: JavaScript/TypeScript, Node.js, React, Java.
* Experience with advanced JavaScript libraries and frameworks
* Experience with APIs and product development
* A passion for writing clear and sustainable code
* Experience with agile methodologies, continuous integration, continuous delivery
* Good spoken and written English skills
* You thrive in an environment where you are responsible for your code and takes ownership of the change from editor to production system
* We understand that you might not have experience in all the areas listed above, but as long as you have the ambition and willingness to learn we would like to hear from you.


 Some of our technologies
   

  

* Javascript / TypeScript
* React / NextJS
* Redux / Redux-Toolkit Query
* Strapi (Headless CMS)
* Node.js and Express.js
* Java 17, Dropwizard
* MySQL
* PostgreSQL
* AWS, Ubuntu, Docker, GitHub Actions


 Who we are
   

  

 We are the best and fastest growing slot provider in the world with the operator and product in focus, and the mobile future on our minds. Nolimit is a team of experienced professionals from the gambling industry in Stockholm, Sweden, Malta and Gurugram, India. Our company has derived from hands on work at some of the most successful gambling software providers and operators over the last 15 years. Our mission is to offer a fast, reliable and flexible team that cooperates with the best operators in the world, taking gambling to the next level.
   

  

 We have a clean code high performance modern mini/micro service portable system platform for mobile and desktop that is 100 % under our own control. Since we have our own platform, this allows us to deliver special features and smooth, customizable marketing campaigns that are tailored to the operator's specific needs. We think it's time for a new angle to the gambling software industry – one where the product is in focus and we fully engage their promotion, marketing and country manager system/activities with our games. Nolimit work with customers on a global scale and the largest gambling operators in the world have our games everywhere.
   

  

 Nolimit City, Stockholm based development team. We provide you with your choice of OS and IDE.
   

  

 Send your application to hr-sweden@nolimitcity.com
   

  

 http://www.nolimitcity.com

title: Vendor Operations Specialist
company_industry: Software Development and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
foodora is part of the Delivery Hero Group, the world’s pioneering local delivery platform, our mission is to deliver an amazing experience—fast, easy, and to your door. We operate in over 70+ countries worldwide. Headquartered in Berlin, Germany. Delivery Hero has been listed on the Frankfurt Stock Exchange since 2017 and is part of the MDAX stock market index.
   

  

**Job Description**
 As a Vendor Operations Specialist in the Marketplace Experience team, you will play a crucial role in optimizing and scaling vendor-facing processes to ensure seamless onboarding, device management and overall performance. Your primary focus will be driving operational excellence by monitoring and improving incubation and zombie vendor metrics, managing SLAs for onboarding and device logistics, and ensuring vendor support targets are met through process improvements. This role requires strong executional capability, analytical thinking, and the ability to collaborate cross-functionally.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities:**
* Vendor Onboarding:
+ Oversee and manage the vendor onboarding process, ensuring all required steps—including documentation collection, training coordination, platform setup, and device logistics—are executed within established SLAs.
+ Monitor onboarding progress and escalate delays or blockers to relevant teams for resolution.
+ Collaborate with sales, onboarding, and marketplace teams to ensure a seamless and timely transition from signed vendor to operational readiness.
+ Identify gaps in the onboarding funnel and work cross-functionally to implement process improvements that drive vendor activation rates and time-to-launch efficiency.

* Incubation & Zombie Vendor Performance:
+ Monitor and manage incubation and zombie vendor performance metrics.
+ Implement corrective actions to improve vendor engagement, readiness, and activation rates.
+ Ensure execution excellence by aligning internal and external stakeholders around performance improvement initiatives.

* Device Management:
+ Oversee device shipments to newly onboarded vendors and manage SLAs to ensure timely delivery.
+ Coordinate with logistics and IT teams to ensure proper device configuration, tracking, and inventory.
+ Manage the collection and deactivation process for devices from churned or inactive vendors.

* Process Optimization:
+ Identify and implement improvements to existing processes, focusing on reducing SLAs and enhancing vendor experience.
+ Lead root-cause analyses for recurring operational issues and work with cross-functional teams to design and roll out solutions.

* Performance Monitoring & Reporting:
+ Develop and maintain dashboards and reports to track vendor operational KPIs.
+ Analyze trends and performance data to proactively address issues and opportunities.

* Cross-Functional Collaboration:
+ Work closely with compliance, legal, product, and local operations teams to align process improvements with business requirements.
+ Support marketplace expansion and transformation projects with vendor-related inputs and execution.

* Continuous Improvement & Project Support:
+ Participate in process reengineering initiatives using Lean/Six Sigma/Agile methodologies.
+ Contribute to business case development and pilot testing for new tools or workflows.


**Qualifications**
* Minimum 2 years of experience in business process optimization, strategic planning, or related fields, ideally in vendor operations.
* Strong analytical skills with the ability to assess data and identify improvement areas.
* Experience working in cross-functional teams and supporting project implementation.
* Familiarity with process improvement methodologies such as Lean, Six Sigma, or Agile.
* Basic project management experience, using tools like Jira or Asana.
* Good communication skills with the ability to work with diverse teams and stakeholders.


**Additional Information**
* Wellness allowance topped with the opportunity to participate in many work/life balance initiatives at foodora such as free group training at Sats & reduced price on massage.
* Employee discount at foodora (woho!) and awesome friday breakfasts!
* Occupational pension, incl. premium exemption insurance, accident insurance and life insurance.
* foodora Learning - Monthly learning sessions about different topics, such as the q-commerce industry, negotiation techniques and project management combined with a structured onboarding and inspiring courses within our learning tool Sana
* Great deals at Benify (for e.g. gym membership, e-bikes hotels, audiobooks, streaming services, clothes, kitchen supplies… and so much more!
* Awesome AW’s and (pink) parties!

title: Information Security Specialist
job_function: Quality Assurance, Information Technology, and Consulting
description:
Nasdaq is now looking for an
 **Information Security Specialist** 
 with a DevSecOps focus to join our application and security team in Stockholm. Are you passionate about DevSecOps, automation, and secure software development and have a genuine interest for Information security? Come join us in this dynamic and constantly evolving environment, apply today!
   

  

 As an
 **Information** 
**Security Specialist** 
 you will focus on the DevSecOps process and all the tooling around it. You should have experience in the DevSecOps field and in addition being familiar with software development security best practices in general.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Design, develop, and maintain CI/CD automation templates and tooling with a DevSecOps mentality.
* Integrate and handle security tools such as: Static Source Code Analysis, Software Composition Analysis, Dynamic Application Security Testing, Code Signing Solutions and Application Security Posture Management.
* Collaborate with development teams to embed security best practices throughout the SDLC.
* Provide guidance to business and development for addressing security issues or questions.
* Conduct penetration tests and security assessments of in house developed applications.
* Participate in Red Teaming activities.


**Education and Professional Accomplishments**
* Degree qualified in Computers Science, Information Systems or other related subject area, or equivalent work experience.
* 3-5 years of relevant working experience.


**Skills And Requirements**
* Have a passion for DevSecOps, automation, continuous improvements, and keeping everything as code.
* Hands on experience working with security tools like SAST, SCA and automate them in CI/CD through scripts and templates.
* Strong scripting skills in Shell and Python.
* Experience working in Cloud environments with Kubernetes and Helm.
* It is a merit if you have completed a Certifications from any of the following organizations: Linux Foundation, Offensive Security, Hack The Box, SANS/GIAC.
* Excellent communication skills in English and in Swedish.


 As a person you are driven and daring. You have a genuine interest for information security and are eager to learn more and deepen your knowledge within this field. You thrive in a constantly evolving environment and continuously want to develop.
   

  

 Nasdaq offers a wide range of possibilities and the opportunity to work in a truly global organization. You get the opportunity to work with expert and knowledgeable colleagues in a fast pace organization where you have the ability to really make a difference.
   

  

**What We Are Offering**
* Annual monetary bonus
* An opportunity to become a Nasdaq shareholder
* Employee Stock Purchase Program Nasdaq stocks with a discount
* Flexible health insurance program
* Flexible working schedule and hybrid way of work
* Additional paid leave days after 2 years of working at Nasdaq
* Flex day program (up to 6 days a year)
* Internal mentorship program – get a mentor or become one
* Wide selection of online learning resources, e.g., Udemy.


**Does this sound like you?**
 We value our talented employees, and whenever possible strive to help one of our associates grow professionally before recruiting new talent to our open positions. If you think the open position, you see is right for you, we encourage you to apply!
   

  

 This is a full-time permanent position located in Stockholm, Sweden. Nasdaq offers you a hybrid workplace to find a balance between working from home and collaborating in the office, therefore it's required to come into the office at least 3 days per week.
   

  

 Desired start date is as soon as possible. As the process is ongoing, please submit your application in English as soon as possible. If you have any questions please contact Talent Acquisition, Silvija Tamošaitytė at silvija.tamosaityte@nasdaq.com.
   

  

**Come as You Are**
**Nasdaq is an equal opportunity employer. We positively encourage applications from suitably qualified and eligible candidates regardless of age, color, disability, national origin, ancestry, race, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, veteran status, genetic information, or any other status protected by applicable law.**
**We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request an accommodation.**

title: IT-Projektledare | Stockholm
description:
*Har du erfarenhet av att driva IT- och digitaliseringsprojekt från start till mål? Lockas du av kombinationen struktur, ledarskap och teknisk? Då kan vi på Chief i Stockholm ha konsultrollen för dig.* 
*V* 
*älkommen med din ansökan!*
**Om rollen:**
 Som IT-projektledare på Chief blir du en nyckelperson i våra kunders digitaliseringsresa. Du leder projekt som ofta syftar till att
 **modernisera system, effektivisera processer** 
**eller** 
**utveckla nya** 
**digitala tjänster.** 
 Arbetet sker i nära samarbete med både verksamhet och IT-organisation.
   

  

 Exempel på vad dina dagar kan innehålla:
   

  

* Driva digitaliserings- och IT-projekt inom områden som exempelvis systemimplementationer, automatisering eller regelverksanpassning
* Leda och koordinera projektteam i agila eller traditionella miljöer
* Ta fram projektplaner, budget och riskhantering
* Säkerställa att leveranser sker i tid, med kvalitet och enligt krav
* Kommunicera med intressenter på olika nivåer


 Våra uppdrag finns i flera branscher med hög efterfrågan på IT-kompetens, exempelvis:
 **bank/finans, ERP, retail, e-handel, energi, life science, fordon, försvar** 
**och** 
**offentlig sektor.** 
 Förutom våra spännande uppdrag, erbjuder vi även mentorskapsprogram, utbildningar och individuell coaching som en del av din fortsatta utveckling.
   

  

**Om dig:**
 Vi söker dig som är kommunikativ, strukturerad och trygg i att leda team. Du har lätt för att engagera människor och driva projekt framåt i komplexa miljöer. Vi ser att du är konsultmässig i ditt arbetssätt;
 **anpassningsbar, lyhörd och professionell** 
 , med förmåga att snabbt sätta dig in i nya verksamheter och förstå kundens behov.
   

  

**Vi ser gärna att du uppfyller följande:**
* Relevant högskoleutbildning eller motsvarande erfarenhet
* 5-15 års erfarenhet av projektledning inom IT eller digitalisering
* Erfarenhet av agila arbetssätt och verktyg (ex. SAFe, Scrum, Jira)
* Flytande svenska och engelska, i tal och skrift


*Meriterande om du har certifiering inom projektledning eller IT-relaterade metoder.*
**Vilka är Chief?**
 Vi är ett entreprenörsdrivet konsultbolag med fokus på
 **teknik och ledarskap** 
 – oavsett bransch. Vi erbjuder dig ett
 **familjärt** 
 sammanhang där fokus ligger på:
   

  

* Valfrihet & anpassning: Som ett personligt bolag anpassar vi oss efter dig som individ, i allt från anställningserbjudande till din framtida karriärutveckling. Vi erbjuder skräddarsydda utbildningar och certifieringar samt tre olika förmånspaket där vi anpassar förmåner och lön efter just din livssituation.
* Gemenskap & utveckling: Personlig- och ledarskapsutveckling i form av mentorskapsprogram, Chief Academy samt andra spännande interna initiativ.


**Tror du att vi är en bra match?** 
**🤝**
 Skicka in din ansökan med CV och personligt brev, eller något annat innovativt som uppfyller samma syfte. Intervjuer och återkoppling sker löpande så skicka in din ansökan redan idag!
   

  

 Vill du veta mer om Chief och rollen så kontakta gärna mig så berättar jag mer!
   

  

 Mattias Nilsson, Business Unit Manager
   

  

 mattias.nilsson@chief.se

title: Assignment Overview
description:
We are seeking a skilled
 **Senior QA Engineer** 
 to play a key role in a large-scale transformation project. The position involves hands-on work with integration, automation, performance, and migration testing, as well as providing guidance and mentorship to other testers. You will take ownership of structuring and driving testing activities across the program while collaborating closely with test leads, product owners, architects, tech leads, and other stakeholders.
   

  

 A QA Engineer is responsible for ensuring that software solutions meet high quality standards before release, identifying potential risks and defects in close cooperation with developers and business representatives.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Design and execute comprehensive test plans, both manual and automated, to verify functionality and performance.
* Document and report defects clearly to facilitate efficient resolution.
* Work closely with development teams to understand new features and technical implementations.
* Conduct regression, integration, and performance testing to secure system stability.
* Uphold quality standards and contribute to continuous improvement of QA processes.
* Collaborate across teams in a dynamic environment while managing your own priorities and schedule.
* Foster a culture of knowledge sharing, teamwork, and proactive problem-solving.


**About Rasulson Consulting**
 Rasulson Consulting is a specialized staffing and recruitment firm focused on the IT sector. We collaborate with leading tech companies and innovative startups to provide exciting career opportunities for individuals passionate about digital development. With our deep technical expertise and extensive network, we efficiently match the right talents with the right assignments. At Rasulson Consulting, you’ll receive personalized guidance, regular feedback, and the chance to take the next step in your IT career.

title: Senior Manager – IT Sales (New Account Hunting)
job_function: Sales, Business Development, and Information Technology
description:
**Job Title** 
 : Senior Manager – IT Sales (New Account Hunting)
 



**Location** 
 : Sweden
 



**Experience** 
 : 8–10 Years in IT Sales / Business Development
 



**Employment Type** 
 : Full-Time
 



  





**Job Brief** 




 We are looking for a passionate and driven Senior Manager – IT Sales to join our team in Sweden. This role is all about growth and new opportunities. You will lead the way in finding new clients, building strong relationships, and helping them succeed with the right IT solutions. Along with driving sales, you will contribute to strategic planning, workforce solutions, and cross-functional collaboration to deliver the best value to clients. If you love challenges, enjoy meeting new people, and get excited about winning new business, this role is perfect for you.
 



  





**Responsibilities** 



* Find and connect with new clients in Sweden, focusing on enterprise and mid-market companies.
* Build a strong pipeline of opportunities through research, networking, and direct sales.
* Manage the full sales cycle – from generating leads to closing big deals.
* Negotiate and finalize contracts with clients to ensure sustainable business growth.
* Work with technical, delivery, and cross-functional teams to create IT solutions (Software, AI, Cloud, ERP, Infrastructure, or Managed Services) that fit client needs.
* Partner with talent acquisition teams to ensure clients also receive workforce and staffing solutions aligned with their needs.
* Contribute to strategic planning, market analysis, and competitive intelligence to refine business approaches.
* Utilize CRM tools and other business development platforms to manage leads, opportunities, and client relationships effectively.
* Meet and exceed sales and revenue goals.
* Stay updated on industry trends, competitors, and customer needs.
* Share sales progress and forecasts with management regularly.



  





**Qualifications** 



* Bachelor’s degree in Business, IT, or a related field (MBA is a plus).
* 8–10 years of proven experience in IT Sales / Business Development in Sweden.
* Strong network of decision-makers in large enterprises (Fortune 1000 preferred).
* Proven record in hunting new accounts and closing big deals.
* Strong expertise in strategic planning, market research, and competitive analysis.
* Hands-on experience with CRM software and business development tools.
* Knowledge of recruitment/talent acquisition processes and workforce planning is a plus.
* Excellent communication, negotiation, and presentation skills.
* Self-motivated, target-driven, and able to work independently and collaboratively.
* Fluency in English (Swedish language is an advantage).
* Experience in the software, technology, or professional services industry is highly desirable.



  





**Why Join Us?** 



* Be part of a fast-growing company with exciting global opportunities.
* Work on cutting-edge IT solutions that truly make a difference.
* Enjoy a culture that values your ideas, drive, and achievements.
* Build strong client relationships and make a visible impact in the market.
* Grow your career with support, recognition, and rewards for success.



  





**Application Instructions** 




 If you possess the qualifications and are driven to excel in your field, we warmly invite you to apply by sharing your updated resume at
 **resumes@empglobal.ae** 
 or by applying directly through this platform.
 



  





**Note:** 
 While we appreciate every application, only shortlisted candidates will be contacted. Thank you for your understanding!

title: Mobil IT Servicetekniker Anstalten Hall
description:
**Om arbetsplatsen**
 Kriminalvården växer – vi bygger nytt, bygger om och bygger till och söker nu fler medarbetare. Vårt viktigaste mål är att minska återfall i brott – att bryta den onda cirkeln. Lyckas vi med det blir samhället tryggare och säkrare för alla. Vi är den myndighet som ansvarar för anstalter, frivård, häkten och klienttransporter.
   

  

 Vill du vara med och bidra till ett tryggare samhälle? Vår IT-avdelning genomför en stor satsning med fokus på en digital Kriminalvård. Tillsammans jobbar vi för att skapa förutsättningar och lösningar som gör skillnad i vår verksamhet. IT-avdelningen är under stark tillväxt. Hos oss får du goda möjligheter att växa och kompetensutvecklas efter dina förutsättningar och intresseområden. Vi söker dig som har ett stort IT-intresse, kunskaper som kan berika vår digitaliseringsresa och som vill vara med och göra skillnad i samhället inom just din profession.
   

  

**Arbetsuppgifter**
 Vi söker dig som vill vara med och bidra till att öka IT-avdelningens lokala stöd ute i kärnverksamheten och som brinner för att hjälpa och utbilda andra människor med digitala hjälpmedel. Du har ett stort intresse av att förstå medarbetarnas behov och krav.
   

  

 Din serviceroll kommer att utgöra ett viktigt gränssnitt mellan IT-avdelningen och kärnverksamheten. Du kommer vara med om en fortsatt unik satsning för Kriminalvården som innebär att forma en ny typ av lokalt IT-stöd för kärnverksamheten.
   

  

 Du kommer att vara placerad på IT-avdelningen under sektionen för IT-Servicecenter och spendera mycket tid ute i kärnverksamheten i klientnära arbete. I ditt geografiska upptagningsområde kommer du att utföra IT-Serviceärenden i vår kärnverksamhet, anstalt, häkte och frivård. Vår verksamhet bedrivs på olika platser i landet, vilket innebär resor inom ditt regionala område i stor utsträckning, även övernattning förekommer i mindre utsträckning. Kriminalvården tillhandahåller poolbilar för dessa tjänster som används under arbetstid.
   

  

 I din serviceroll kommer du på ett kreativt sätt att bidra till ökad digital mognad i verksamheten genom att t.ex. agera rådgivande, guida och stötta personal gällande IT-avdelningens tjänster och bidra till att utveckla det lokala IT-säkerhetsarbetet. Du stöttar verksamheten med IT-serviceärenden och IT-supporten med problemlösning. Vidare medverkar du till tjänsteutveckling genom att löpande inhämta förbättringsförslag och synpunkter på IT:s tjänster och applikationer. Du stöttar även IT-avdelningen med specifika uppdrag som exempelvis implementeringar och livscykelhantering av hårdvara.
   

  

**Kvalifikationer**
 Vi söker dig som är självgående och tar ansvar för samt driver dina processer framåt. Du har en god samarbetsförmåga och är både lyhörd, tydlig och smidig i din kommunikation. Vidare har du en god förståelse för hur människan tar till sig kunskap och människors olika förutsättningar. Detta gör att du har lätt för att anpassa ditt sätt att förmedla och nå fram med ditt budskap till mottagaren.
   

  

 Som person har du en positiv attityd och inställning till ditt jobb och verksamheten i stort. Du följer och handlar i enlighet med fattade beslut, verksamhetsplanen, mål, policys och riktlinjer. Vidare är du serviceinriktad och i dialog och möten med andra är du lugn, uppmärksam och tillmötesgående. Du har ett stort intresse för att hjälpa andra och ger det lilla extra för att leverera lösningar. Slutligen är du även strukturerad och du planerar, organiserar och prioriterar ditt arbete på ett effektivt sätt för att säkerställa att du håller uppsatta tidsramar.
   

  

 För oss är det viktigt att du delar Kriminalvårdens grundläggande värderingar om en human människosyn, respekt för individen samt tron på människans vilja och förmåga att utvecklas. Du är även medveten om och har förståelse för hur bakgrund, kultur och grupptillhörighet påverkar dig själv och andra. Vidare förväntas du med ditt förhållningssätt bidra till att alla blir likvärdigt bemötta. Vi lägger stor vikt vid personlig lämplighet.
   

  

 Vi söker dig som har:
   

  

* Fullständig gymnasiekompetens i form av slutbetyg eller gymnasieexamen alternativt annan utbildning i kombination med erfarenhet som Kriminalvården bedömer som relevant
* Erfarenhet av arbete inom service
* Förmåga att uttrycka dig väl i tal och skrift på svenska
* B-körkort


 Det är meriterande om du har:
   

  

* Utbildning med inriktning mot IT
* Erfarenhet av arbete i Kriminalvårdens kärnverksamhet
* Erfarenhet av support till slutanvändare
* Erfarenhet av service med inriktning mot IT eller teknik
* Erfarenhet av arbete som onsite tekniker eller liknande
* Kunskap och förståelse av tjänstehantering och dess support
* Kunskap om hårdvara gällande PC, tunna terminaler, bärbara datorer, skrivare och videoutrustning
* Förståelse för komplexiteten med att arbeta i större organisationer


**Övrig information**
 För att bli aktuell för anställning inom Kriminalvården krävs att du motsvarar högt ställda krav gällande lämplighet, omdöme, säkerhets- och sekretessmedvetande och att du följer gällande lagar. Det innebär att du står upp för demokratiska värderingar och den statliga värdegrund som gäller för Kriminalvårdens verksamhet.
   

  

 Vissa befattningar är placerade i säkerhetsklass och då kommer en säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll att genomföras innan beslut om anställning fattas. För vissa säkerhetsklassade tjänster krävs svenskt medborgarskap. Kriminalvården välkomnar sökande med olika bakgrund och erfarenheter. Läs mer om säkerhetsprövningen på: https://www.kriminalvarden.se/jobba-hos-oss/rekryteringsprocessen/sakerhetsprovning-vid-rekrytering/
   

  

 Befattningen kan innebära krigsplacering vid Kriminalvården. Läs mer om krigsplacering på: https://www.kriminalvarden.se/jobba-hos-oss/rekryteringsprocessen/krigsplacering/
   

  

 Provanställning kan komma att tillämpas.
   

  

 Kriminalvården strävar efter en jämn könsfördelning och ökad mångfald.
   

  

 För att skicka in din ansökan, klicka på ansökningslänken i annonsen. Frågor om hur du ansöker och lägger in ditt CV ställer du direkt till Visma Recruit. Frågor om specifika jobb besvaras av den kontaktperson som anges i annonsen.
   

  

 Vi undanber oss vänligen men bestämt direktkontakt med bemannings- och rekryteringsföretag samt försäljare av rekryteringsannonser. Kriminalvården har upphandlade avtal.

title: Data Scientist
description:
We are seeking a Data Scientist to develop, maintain, and optimize AI models for recommendations and personalization. In this role, you will take ownership of the entire ML lifecycle—from data exploration and model development to deployment and monitoring—to deliver scalable, production-ready solutions that create real user impact.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Build and enhance AI models (recommendation systems, LLM-based applications) and their pipelines.
* Improve the performance and reliability of production systems.
* Collaborate with product managers to identify use cases and develop proof-of-concepts.
* Apply MLOps best practices for deployment, monitoring, and system maintenance.
* Perform ad-hoc data analysis and visualization to support decision-making.


**Qualifications**
* Strong Python skills and experience writing production-quality code.
* Hands-on experience with Deep Learning (Computer Vision, NLP).
* Proficiency with frameworks such as PyTorch, Scikit-learn, and TensorFlow.
* Experience with MLOps and CI/CD, preferably in GCP (Vertex AI).
* Proficient with Git and version control.
* Solid SQL knowledge.
* Practical experience with recommendation and personalization systems.
* Familiarity with LLM technologies (prompt engineering, RAG, LangChain, LangGraph, vector databases).
* Hands-on experience with Docker and Kubernetes.
* Ability to develop and maintain REST APIs.
* Experience working with Redis.
* Knowledge of DBT.
* Comfortable working in Agile environments and collaborating in cross-functional teams.


**About Rasulson Consulting**
 Rasulson Consulting is a specialized staffing and recruitment firm focused on the IT sector. We collaborate with leading tech companies and innovative startups to provide exciting career opportunities for individuals passionate about digital development. With our deep technical expertise and extensive network, we efficiently match the right talents with the right assignments. At Rasulson Consulting, you’ll receive personalized guidance, regular feedback, and the chance to take the next step in your IT career.

title: SAP Program Director
description:
**Role:** 
 SAP Program Director
 



**Experience (Years):** 
 17+ Years
 



**Language requirement:** 
 Swedish & English
 



  





**Tata consultancy Services** 
 is an IT services, consulting and business solutions organization that has been partnering with many of the world’s largest businesses for the past 50 years. We believe innovation and collective knowledge can transform all our futures with greater purpose. We help companies across industries achieve their strategic goals and lead their digital transformation programs. With 600,000 experts globally and 18,000+ consultants working for leading Nordic Customers, we have a strong sense of purpose for the ecosystem around us – our employees, partners, customers and society.
 



  





**Must-Have:** 




  





**1) Program Leadership:** 




  




* Lead and oversee SAP conversion program and optimization projects, ensuring they align with overall business objectives and deliver value to the organization.
* Establish and maintain strong relationships with key stakeholders across the business to secure their involvement and commitment throughout the project.



  





**2) Business Alignment:** 




  




* Ensure that the program’s goals are closely aligned with the company’s strategic business objectives.
* Work closely with senior executives and business leaders to understand their needs and ensure these are reflected in the SAP implementation.



  





**3) Communication Strategy:** 




  




* Develop and execute comprehensive communication plans to keep all stakeholders informed and engaged.
* Ensure that project updates, milestones, and changes are effectively communicated across the organization.



  





**4) Project Management:** 




  




* Oversee the day-to-day management of the SAP program, ensuring that projects are delivered on time, within scope, and within budget.
* Identify, manage, and mitigate project risks and issues to ensure successful project outcomes.



  





**5) Performance Monitoring:** 




  




* Track and report on program performance, providing regular updates to senior management.
* Ensure that all deliverables meet the required quality standards and business requirements.



  





**Experience required:** 




  




* Proven experience as a Senior Program Director or Senior Project Director, with a strong track record of leading large-scale SAP implementation and optimization projects.
* Experience in aligning complex IT projects with business objectives in a global or multinational company.



  





**Skills:** 




  




* Excellent English language skills, both written and spoken.
* Strong leadership and interpersonal skills, with the ability to engage and influence stakeholders at all levels.
* Expertise in developing and executing communication strategies for large projects.
* Deep understanding of SAP systems and their implementation in large organizations.



  





**Technical Skills:** 




  




* Proficiency in project management tools and methodologies.
* Strong understanding of SAP software, particularly in implementation and optimization contexts.



  





**Good to have:** 




  




* Strong SAP S/4 implementation Experience
* Knowledge in Retail business



  





**Responsibility of / Expectations from the Role** 




  




* Proven experience as a Senior Program Director or Senior Project Director, with a strong track record of leading
* Experience in aligning complex IT projects with business objectives in a global or multinational company
* Proficiency in project management tools and methodologies
* Deep understanding of SAP systems and their implementation in large organizations
* Should be focused in on-time delivery



  





**Does that sound interesting?** 




  





 You are welcome to submit your application consisting of your CV, personal letter, relevant degrees or certifications details, professional references, etc. We work with ongoing recruitment so send in your application as soon as possible.
 



  





 We look forward to receiving your application via LinkedIn or mail to
 **ajay.androw@tcs.com** 




  





**Privacy Note: https://ibegin.tcs.com/iBegin/privacy-notice**

title: Erfaren Nätverkstekniker
description:
Vi söker nu en erfaren Nätverkstekniker som vill bli en del av vår kunds kompetenta team. Dukommer att arbeta i en dynamisk miljö där nätverkssäkerhet och stabil driftstår i fokus, och du får möjlighet att utveckla både din kompetens och kundensinfrastruktur.
 



**Arbetsuppgifter** 



* Design, implementation och förvaltning av avancerade nätverkslösningar
* Felsökning och optimering av routing- och switchingmiljöer
* Konfiguration och drift av brandväggar, främst Palo Alto
* Implementering av säkerhetslösningar enligt Zero Trust-principer och/eller Zscaler
* Hantering och optimering av trådlösa nätverk (Wireless)
* Nära samarbete med kundens IT-team, projektledare och andra intressenter



**Kvalifikationer** 



* Certifieringar inom
 **CCNP eller CCIE**
* Djup kompetens inom
 **routing och switching**
* Erfarenhet av
 **brandväggar och säkerhetslösningar** 
 (Palo Alto är meriterande)
* Kunskap om
 **Zero Trust-ramverk**
* Erfarenhet av 
 **Zscaler**
* Erfarenhet av
 **trådlösa nätverk (Wireless)**
* Förmåga att kommunicera obehindrat på
 **svenska och engelska** 
 , både i tal och skrift



**Som person** 
 ser vi att du är analytisk, noggrann och lösningsorienterad, med ett genuint intresse för nätverk och IT-säkerhet. Du är självgående och tar ansvar för ditt arbete, men trivs också med att samarbeta i team och bidra med din kompetens. Du drivs av att vara med och utveckla vår kunds nätverksmiljö och säkerhet, och vill vara en nyckelperson i deras fortsatta resa mot en modern och säker IT-infrastruktur.
 



**Start** 
 : Omgående start med hänsyn till uppsägningstid. Uppdraget är på heltid och är tillsvidare
   





**Placeringsort:** 
  Stockholm
 



**Ansökan:** 
 Intervjuer sker löpande och tillsättning sker vid rätt match
   

  





**Vad vi står för:**
 Vi på Camai erbjuder ett av marknadens branschledande anställningsvillkor med stor frihet som ledord. Vi drivs av att hitta det bästa uppdraget för våra medarbetare. Det roligaste som finns är att hitta en perfekt matchning mellan konsult och kund. Vi vet att alla har ett drömarbete, och vi är ett tight entreprenörsdrivet team som arbetar för att se till att du tycker att det är roligt att gå till jobbet, varje dag. Vi tror att kompetenta människor dras till varandra och vill jobba med likasinnade i spännande kunduppdrag.
 



 Vi har en av marknadens mest förmånliga ersättningsmodell anpassad för en modern konsultorganisation med mycket frihet. Vi har helt enkelt kul tillsammans!
   





**Varför ska du välja oss?**
 Med många års erfarenhet i konsultbranschen har vi valt våra tre värdeord med omsorg; kommunikation, ambition och balans. För att lyckas tror vi att våra medarbetare får vara med och forma sitt arbete efter prioriteringar och intresse i livet. Med din ambition och rätt verktyg från oss ser vi till att du utvecklas och samtidigt belönas på vägen.
   





*Hoppas att du vill vara en del av vår fortsatta tillväxt!*

title: Technology Planning Expert
description:
**We are looking for a Technology Planning Expert.** 




 In this role, you will work closely with Huawei’s industry development team, technology planning team, and local R&D team to provide deep insights into European resources, and help Huawei better understand the achievements and organization of the concerned resources.

 Full-time consulting position

 Huawei R&D facility, Kista, Stockholm

title: Senior .NET Backend Engineer
description:
We now have a new requirement and are looking for a consultant colleague with the qualifications listed below. The position is part of our consulting business, which means you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments.
   

  

*As part of your application, you may be presented to clients/partners as part of the recruitment process. If selected for the assignment, you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments as part of our consulting business.*
****Essential requirements:****
* Solid experience in backend development with .NET Core and C#
* Experience from modern cloud-based development (GCP, Azure, AWS)
* Experience with containerization (Docker/Kubernetes), CI/CD, observability
* Understanding of DevOps, security and maintainability in production environments
* Ability to build solutions with awareness of the broader business context


**Meritorious:**
* Experience from order management and trading systems
* Knowledge of real-time workloads, GraphQL, pub/sub
* Familiarity with Terraform, gRPC, in-memory caching technologies


**Last day to apply** 
 : 22-09-2025
   

  

**About Us**
 We currently employ experienced consultants in areas such as System Development, AI, Machine Learning, Testing, Cloud, Infra DevOps, and IT Project Management.
   

  

 Working at Deploja is something entirely different from working at an ordinary consulting company—and we are really proud of that. So, what makes us unique?
   

  

 We simply offer more than just a high salary and greater freedom; that’s just the beginning. With us, you’ll find the work environment and opportunities you deserve. Welcome to Deploja, where the grass is indeed greener!
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Exciting assignments with our many clients. We focus on long-term projects, which gives you the opportunity to create value for the client while also developing yourself.
   

  

 🌟 A secure monthly salary – together we’ll agree on a base salary depending on your assignments.
   

  

 🚗 Company car – we encourage you to choose an electric car for a more sustainable future.
   

  

 💼 Occupational pension and great opportunities for salary conversion.
   

  

 🌴 Vacation – Would you like more than 30 days of vacation, perhaps 60 days?
   

  

 🏥 Private health insurance, accident insurance, and life insurance for increased security.
   

  

 📚 Skills development – you set your own budget and choose the training you wish to attend.
   

  

 🕑 Quality of life – Are you struggling to balance everyday life and wish to work a little less while still earning as much, if not more?
   

  

*We handle applications continuously, and due to the high workload, it's especially important to include a short motivation for the position, explaining how you meet the requirements.*

title: DevOps Engineer
company_industry: Medical Equipment Manufacturing, Biotechnology Research, and Hospitals and Health Care
description:
**With a passion for life**
 Join our diverse teams of passionate people and a career that allows you to develop both personally and professionally. At Getinge we exist to make life-saving technology accessible for more people. To make a true difference for our customers – and to save more lives, we need team players, forward thinkers, and game changers.
   

  

 Are you looking for an inspiring career? You just found it.
   

  

**About This Opportunity**
 We are looking for a passionate and skilled DevOps Engineer to join our Platform team. In this role, you’ll play a key part in designing, building, and maintaining our CI/CD pipelines, cloud infrastructure, and collaborative workflows. This is a hands-on role that combines technical expertise with the ability to work effectively across teams.
   

  

 You’ll work closely with developers, QA, and other stakeholders to ensure the delivery of high-quality, scalable software. If you’re excited about creating efficient systems, championing collaboration, and contributing to a growing team, we’d love to hear from you.
   

  

**Our Tech Stack**
 Here’s a glimpse into the tools and technologies we use to deliver world-class solutions:
   

  

* CI/CD: GitLab CI
* Cloud Platforms: Microsoft Azure (primary)
* Containers & Orchestration: Docker, Kubernetes
* Infrastructure as Code: Terraform, Helm, Ansible, JSON, YAML
* Monitoring & Logging: Prometheus, Grafana, Azure
* Languages & Scripting: Python, Go, Bash
* Version Control: Gitlab, Github
* Security & Compliance: SBOM, dependency tracking, vulnerability scanning


 We continuously explore new technologies to improve our workflows, and you’ll have the opportunity to influence our stack.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* CI/CD Pipelines: Develop and maintain robust, reusable CI/CD pipelines to support agile software delivery.
* Infrastructure as Code (IaC): Design and manage cloud infrastructure using tools like Terraform, Kubernetes, or similar.
* Automation: Identify opportunities for automation and optimization in build, test, and deployment workflows.
* Collaboration: Foster a collaborative team culture by promoting practices like pair programming, code reviews, and knowledge sharing.
* Monitoring & Troubleshooting: Ensure system reliability and performance by setting up monitoring, logging, and alerting. Respond to incidents and resolve issues proactively.
* Security & Compliance: Integrate security best practices into the development lifecycle, including vulnerability scanning and dependency tracking.
* Team Enablement: Support developers and QA teams by streamlining workflows and improving development tools.


**You’ll bring**
**Tools & Technologies**
* Proficiency in CI/CD tools like GitLab CI, Jenkins, or similar.
* Strong knowledge of cloud platforms (Azure preferred) and container orchestration tools like Kubernetes.
* Experience working with containers and Linux environment
* Experience with scripting and automation using Python, Bash, or similar.
* Collaboration: Proven ability to work closely with cross-functional teams and foster a collaborative work environment.
* Problem-Solving: A proactive approach to identifying and resolving system bottlenecks or inefficiencies.


**Nice-to-Have Skills**
* Knowledge of test automation frameworks and integration with CI/CD pipelines.
* Exposure to agile software development practices.
* Knowledge of any of these programming language – Go, Python, Java, JavaScript, C++
* Familiarity with the Yocto build system


**Why join Getinge**
 You’ll work on cutting-edge medical software that spans embedded firmware, cloud-native infrastructure, and device interoperability.
